See Edit Access Privileges to Items.Statuses Items in any status with the exception of Archived.Rackable, Non-rackable and Passive items are supported.ItemsZero-U items are not supported.See Identifying an Item in a Cabinet Elevation.Drag-and-drop an item to any free position in the destination cabinet that has sufficient, contiguousrack units to accommodate the item.Once dropped, the item's previously occupied space is made available for new items.Drag-and-drop can be performed in a Cabinet Elevation while in Text view and Image view.Position in cab-Items mounted to front or back rails when dropped, they get mounted to the side that the cabinetinet and elev-is displaying at time of drop.ation viewItems mounted on both rails when dropped remain on both rails when dropped regardless of Frontview or Back view.See Cabinet Elevation Drop-Down - Front, Back, Image and Text.Drag-and-drop is not supported when moving items above or below cabinets. Select either Aboveor Below from the U Position drop-down to move an item above or below a cabinet, if applicable.All Planned circuits will be deletedConnectionsAll Installed or Powered off circuits associated with the item will have disconnect request issued.IP Address Managed IP addresses will be deleted if item is dropped to cabinet in different locationTo drag and drop item from one cabinet to another follow below steps :1. In the item list select the source and destination cabinets.2. Left-click on the item in the source Cabinet Elevation, then drag-and-drop the item to a position in the destinationcabinet with sufficient contiguous rack units to accommodate it.For Planned items the U Position drop-down is updated with the item's new RU once the item is dropped into its des-tination cabinet’s U position.For Installed items, you will get move request dialog and only when you confirm the move request is issued. the itemdropped will be a new “when-moved” item. The original dragged item remains in its original cabinet till the moverequest is complete.Drag-and-drop is supported in the Web Client.Users with either the System Administrator, Gatekeeper, Operator, or Operator without Delete Roles may drag-and-drop Blades.Drag-and-drop for blades is performed on the Blade's or Chassis item page from the Blades tab if moving the bladeto a different position within the same Chassis.You can also move Blades between Chassis from the Item's List using drag-and-drop.The blade's new slot must be on the same side, front or back; you cannot move the blade to the other side of achassis.You can only move a blade to slot that can support it and that is available. For example, you cannot move a full-blade to a half-blade slot, and you cannot move a blade to a slot that is grayed out (designated as unavailable). Youcan however, move Blades from a horizontal Chassis to vertical Chassis and vice versa.IP addresses assigned to ports are retained when moving a Blade to a Chassis in the same Location.IP addresses assigned to ports are deleted when moving a Blade to a Chassis in a different Location.Privileges See Edit Access Privileges to Items.Statuses Items in any status with the exception of Archived.Any item visible in the chassis elevation:ItemsDevice or network bladesDevice or network chassisDrag-and-drop an item to any free slot within the same chassis.The slot's form factor must be able to accommodate the blade - for example, a half, full and soon.Blades cannot be dragged-and-dropped into slots that are designated as 'Unavailable'. SeePosition in cabinetand elevation viewOnce saved, the occupied slot is made available.Drag-and-drop front facing blades in the chassis to other slots facing the front of the chassis.Drag-and-drop front rear blades in the chassis to other slots facing the back of the chassis.For more information on slot positions, see About Blade Chassis Slots.All connections are retained when moving a Blade to a different U Position within the sameConnectionsChassis. All connections are disconnected when moving a Blade to a different Chassis.

1. Open an Item's Page in Edit mode. This is the blade's item page.2. The chassis elevation is displayed on the Blades tab of the page.Note: Blades facing Front cannot be dragged-and-dropped Back and vice versa.3. Left-click on the blade in the chassis elevation view, then drag-and-drop the blade to a new slot in the chassisthat can to accommodate it.The Slot Position drop-down in the Placement section automatically reflects the new slot position.The blade's connections are retained when its slot is changed within the chassis.4. Click Save.The slot number(s) in the Blades tab under the Blades column is updated at this point.Once saved, the blade's previously occupied slot is made available.1. Select the Chassis the Blade currently resides in from the Item List. The first Chassis elevation is displayed inthe List.2. Select the destination Chassis. The second Chassis elevation is displayed in the list.3. Drag the Blade from its position in the first Chassis to the desired position in the second Chassis4. The Blade is immediately moved to the new Chassis.5. If the Blade is in an Installed status, a Move request will be automatically generated. If Request Bypass is on,the Move request will be automatically completed.Optional: If you are using dcTrack's Change Control workflow, you can submit a Quick Move Item Request insteadof using drag-and-drop or manually changing the item's position in the Slot drop-down.

Change a blade's slot position within the same chassis by -Selecting a new slot position from the Slot Position drop-down on the blade's item page while it is in Edit modeOrDragging-and-dropping the blade to a new position within its blade chassis elevationSee Drag-and-Drop a Blade to a New Slot in a Chassis.To remove a blade from a chassis, submit a Decommission to Storage or Decommission to Archive request.See Putting Items in Storage - Decommission Item to Storage Request or Archiving Items - Decommission Item toArchive Request.To move a blade within the same chassis -Drag-and-Drop a Blade to a New Slot in a ChassisChanging a Blade's Slot Position in a Blade ChassisTo move the blade to another chassis -Move Item Requests for Blade Servers and Blades

As of dcTrack version 9.0.0 users can properly place Zero-U Rack PDUs. As a result they display correctly in FloorMaps. To determine if a Rack PDU will fit in a cabinet, dcTrack uses the cabinet height in inches as it compares theRack PDU height in inches instead of making the determination based on RUs.For example, a 10 RU Cabinet whose height is 21 inches can accommodate a Zero-U Rack PDU that is 12 RU and20 inches. This allows you to place the Rack PDU in a U-Position within the cabinet.Additionally, Zero-U Rack PDUs on Floor Maps will now correctly display within the dimensions of the cabinet.Items with a status of Archived can be purged from dcTrack without first requiring the item to transition to "Planned".Since purging an Item removes the Item completely from the database, previously this feature was limited to userswith the System Administrator role. dcTrack version 9.0.0 introduced a new Auxiliary Functional role, "ManageArchived Items". Users with this role will also be allowed to Edit and Delete Archived Items. Operators and Gate-keepers will no longer be allowed to Edit Archived Items unless they also have the "Manage Archived Items" roleassigned.Please refer to the documentation on Auxiliary Functional roles for additional information.Steps to Purge Archived Items:1. In the Web UI, navigate to the Items List.2. Filter the Item List to include the Archived Items you want to purge.3. Select the Items.4. Click Delete in the toolbar.5. Click Yes to confirm that you want to delete the items.Archived Items can also be deleted from the Item Detail page.Note: Items with open Work Orders or Requests can not be deletedImportant: Use caution when you decide to use purge as deleted records can not be recovered.

Customizing your Items List and Circuits List provides you with the ability to define your default view of the data thatis important to you, the ability to search, sort and filter data so you can locate items or information you need, runreports for inventory purposes and much more.For example, you can customize your Items List for the following:The list is sorted by Location. See Sort Data on a List Page in the Web ClientYou specify the amount of rows to display on the page by default. See Update the Rows per Page on ListPages.You change the default order of your columns. For example, follow Location by the Status of your cabinets atthe location, then the Cabinets, Cabinet Name, their Row Label, and so on. See Reorder Columns on ListPages.Columns are added or hidden from view (as long as they are not required). See Show or Hide Columns onList Pages.Once you are done, you can save your custom view. See Save Your Customized List Page Settings.After you customize the Items List page and Circuits List page by reordering, hiding and displaying columns, savethe changes as a View. To make them your default, select the Set As Default View Option.If you do not save the View settings, any changes you make to the view are lost when you log off of dcTrack.Default Views do not change after you log off. They are saved until you switch back to the default dcTrack view byselecting the Set As Default View option for the System View.Unless they are shared using the Share View option, View settings apply only to your dcTrack session and do notapply to all users. Shared Views are available to other users and users may select any Shared View as their defaultview.

Save View Saves current settings to the currently selected viewClone View Allows you to make a copy of the selected view with a new nameRename View Allows you to rename the selected viewSet As DefaultAllows you to make the selected view your Default viewViewDelete View Allows you to delete the selected viewShare View Allows you to make the selected view available to other usersTo save the current listing as a new view, click the icon in the upper rightcorner of the page.Sort data in ascending and descending order by clicking on any of the column headers on a list page to access theSort drop-down.1 Click the chevron to access a Sort drop-down.2 Click Ascending or Descending.Only one sort order can be applied to the list at a time. For example, you can sort the Items List in ascending orderby Name, but you cannot sort by Name, Make and Model.Hide Column will hide the column you're in.Copy to Clipboard copies the column in the row you have selected.Pin Left will make the current column you're in the very first visible column in your view.Pin Right will make the current column you're in the very last visible column of your view.Note: dcTrack does not prevent you from selecting different sort orders for multiple columns at once, but it does notapply the sorting.If you leave a list page during a current dcTrack session, the settings you applied remain.Once you log off of dcTrack, the dcTrack default settings are reapplied.However, the settings can be saved using the Save Configuration function.Click the Save Config icon on the taskbar at the bottom of the page, then click Save Current List Settings.Once saved, the settings become the default list view until you change them or reset them to the dcTrack defaults.For more details on the Save Configuration function, see Save Your Customized List Page Settings.

Change the order of the columns on any list page by clicking on a column header, holding down your left mouse but-ton, and dragging the column to the position you want it.If you export list data to a CSV file, the columns are exported in the order you apply. See Exporting List Data to a.CSV File from the Web ClientIf you leave a list page during a current dcTrack session, the settings you applied remain.Once you log off of dcTrack, the dcTrack default settings are reapplied.However, the settings can be saved using the Save Configuration function.Click the Save Config icon on the taskbar at the bottom of the page, then click Save Current List Settings.Once saved, the settings become the default list view until you change them or reset them to the dcTrack defaults.For more details on the Save Configuration function, see Save Your Customized List Page Settings.Use the Show/Hide Columns function to hide and show columns on the Items List and Circuits List.Click the Show/Hide Columns icon on the far right side of each grid to view the show/hide column options.The options in the list are based on the available columns on the page and custom fields created for your version ofdcTrack.Note: Some columns are required and cannot be hidden, such as Location, Model and Status on the Items List andCreation Date on the Circuits List.This feature is useful to customize your list view and determine the data exported to CSV from the list page.For example, you can create a custom Items List that displays only specific columns. Only those columns and theirdata are exported to the CSV file when it is generated.For more details on exporting, see Exporting List Data to a .CSV File from the Web Client.If you leave a list page during a current dcTrack session, the settings you applied remain.Once you log off of dcTrack, the dcTrack default settings are reapplied.However, the settings can be saved by storing the selections as a view.Once saved, the view can be set as the default list view until you change them or reset them to the dcTrack defaults.For more details on the Save Configuration function, see Save Your Customized List Page Settings.

On List pages, you can specify the number of rows displayed at once by selecting from the "Rows per Page" drop-down in the task bar. For example, you can specify Fit, 50, 200 and so on."Fit" is the default and displays as many rows in the list as your computer display allows. "All" displays all records.Note that this could be a large number of rows depending on the number of records."Rows per Page" directly impacts what is exported to your CSV file when you specify "Export Current Page".For example, if only 50 rows are displayed on the page, only 50 rows are exported to the CSV file.If you have a total of 1000 rows you intended to export, select the option when you export to CSV. Alternatively,select 1000 from the "Rows per Page" drop-down and specify "Export Current Page".If you leave a list page during a current dcTrack session, the settings you applied remain.Once you log off of dcTrack, the dcTrack default settings are reapplied.However, the settings can be saved using the Save Configuration function.Click the Save Config icon on the taskbar at the bottom of the page, then click Save Current List Settings.Once saved, the settings become the default list view until you change them or reset them to the dcTrack defaults.For more details on the Save Configuration function, see Save Your Customized List Page Settings.Selecting cabinets in the Items List will display their respective cabinet elevations in a side panel. Use the Ctrl orShift key to select multiple cabinets.When only one cabinet is selected, use the draggable divider to increase the size of the cabinet elevation space tozoom the cabinet view.Note: Use the Elevation button in the toolbar to pin the cabinet elevation divider in its current position so that itdoesn’t automatically adjust as you select and deselect cabinets from the items list.

In the Item List when more than one cabinet is selected, user need to click Show Elevation button to get the CabinetElevation of the selected cabinets in the Item List.The cabinet elevation for each cabinet will have common toolbar that will allow to you to switch between text andimages and front and back views, as well as Cabinet Inspector and Health Inspector views.Cabinets that do include items that are part of the circuits are turned into x-ray mode. All cabinets that do not containitems that are included in the displayed circuits are dropped to the floor.Selecting a Chassis in the Items list displays its elevation based on the Slot and Bay placement defined in themodel. When displayed in text view, the elevation displays the Bays based on the proportions defined by the Modelrepresenting the Size of each Bay, the Slots contained in each Bay and any spacing that exists between or adjacentto each Bay. Slots that are occupied by a Blade display the text as selected from the tool bar. You can select one ofthe options from the menu or customize the selection to include a total of up to 10 fields from which to choose.When Chassis are displayed in image view the elevation again displays based on the Slot and Bay placement asdefined by the Model. The image also includes the Chassis image, each slot, and the image of any Blades that havebeen placed in the Chassis.In both text and image view, hovering over a Blade displays additional details about the Blade. Clicking the Ham-burger icon in the elevation header displays 2 options. You can select to be directed to the Chassis Item detail page,or display a legend describing how colors are assigned in the elevations.You can also click the down arrow on any Blade to reveal additional options. You can chose to be redirected to theBlades Item detail page, view the Blades Ports, be redirected to the Chassis Item detail page, or view an expandedversion of the Chassis elevation and its contents.

Displaying Chassis within a Cabinet behaves exactly as it does when viewing the specific Chassis elevation. Whenthe cabinet is displayed in text view the Chassis within the Cabinet are also displayed in text view. When the cabinetis displayed in image view the Chassis and Blades within the Cabinet are also displayed in image view. Clicking thehamburger icon in the Cabinets header will display additional options allowing you to be redirected to the Cabinetdetail page, view the Cabinet Legend, view the Chassis Legend or have the option of viewing the Chassis Elevationalone or the Chassis Elevation including any Blades contained within the Chassis. Chassis Elevation is not thedefault view however, it can be toggled on by clicking the Chassis Elevation option from the menu.dcTrack version 8.1.1 supports a new Mounting type of "Suspended" for Cabinet Class Models. You can createCabinet Models with Suspended Mounting and create and manage Suspended Cabinet Items.Suspended Mounting Cabinets support following Form Factors.2-Post Frame4-Post EnclosureSuspended Mounting Cabinets can be used to represent overhead rack above a free-standing cabinet which is alsoreferred as Cabinet Extender.Cabinet Items with Suspended Mounting can share the same Row and Position in Row as a Free-Standing Cabinet.Suspended Cabinet Items can also share the same Item Name as one Free-Standing Cabinet in the same location.However multiple Suspended Cabinet Items can share the same Row and Position row.Suspended Cabinets behave same as a Free-Standing Cabinet with the following exception :1. When Suspended Cabinets share the same Row and Position in Row as Free-Standing Cabinet, the name ofthe Suspended Cabinet must match the name of the Free-Standing Cabinet. The field Row and Position inRow will become read only for Suspended Cabinet items and can only be updated from the Free-StandingCabinet with same name.2. Only when the Item Name of the Suspended Cabinet is unique, the field Row and Position in Row will be edit-able. Hence Power Outlet items can not be placed in Suspended Cabinets.3. Items can be placed in Suspended Cabinets. However the U position Above and Below will not be availablefor Suspended Cabinets.4. Cabinet field in the Item Details page will have the suffix Suspended added to the Suspended Cabinet Nameto distinguish the Suspended Cabinets from the Free-Standing Cabinets specially when they share the samename.5. Power Outlets can not be placed in a Suspended Cabinet.Suspended Cabinets Items can also be created and managed using File Import. Model column is required for theEDIT operation when updating a Suspended Cabinet item view File Import.When placing Items in a Suspended Cabinet view File Import, make sure to add the suffix (Suspended) in theCabinet column. For example the Cabinet Column should have a value "1A (Suspended)".

Cabinet with Suspended Mounting can share the same Row and Position in Row as a Free-Standing Cabinet andother suspended cabinets.Cabinet Elevation will show all the cabinets sharing the same Row and Position in Row in the same elevation view.All the buttons in the Cabinet Elevation toolbar apply to all the Cabinets in the Cabinet Elevation.dcTrack 8.2 introduces a new form factor 2-Post Frame for Cabinets. Cabinet models with mounting Free-Standingor Suspended can have form factor of 2-Post Frame.Cabinet that has a Form-Factor of 2-Post Rack is rendered in floor map with only one set of rails at the front of theCabinet.Note: When creating objects in CAD file for 2-Post Frame cabinets it is recommended to hatch the ~4" width of themounting posts and not the wider bracket at the base. Adding poly lines to represent the base bracket without hatch-ing them give a nice visual effect when rendered in 3D.Since Cabinets with 2-Post Frame form factor have rails at the front you can place only one item at the front of thecabinet for a U position.The field Rails Used become read only and set to Front when you place an item in 2-Post Frame Cabinet.

When you are integrated with Power IQ, use Cabinet Live Charts on cabinet pages to quickly gain access to powerreadings and event information. Specifically, Cabinet Live Charts provide reading totals at the cabinet, rack PDU out-let, rack PDU breaker, and rack PDU inlet levels.Use this information to monitor power trends over select time periods and view corresponding events. This is usefulif you want to track trends and monitor power at a granular level.Cabinet Live Chart settings are saved per user and are applied to all cabinets you have access to. So, you can con-figure charts to display the information you want to see in the way you want to see it, and the same configuration isapplied to all cabinets you have access to - you do not have to configure each cabinet separately. For example, setcharts on a cabinet to display average readings for the past week and the same settings are applied to all of yourcabinets.

Cabinet Live Charts are available on cabinet pages provided:Your dcTrack is integrated with Power IQ and Power IQ Integration is enabled in dcTrack.The rack PDUs in the cabinet being viewed are powered on and configured in Power IQ and dcTrack.Note: To verify you are integrated with Power IQ and it is enabled for a location, select Admin > dcTrack Settings.Easily identify items with Cabinet Live Charts from the Items List in the Web Client by filtering the PIQ Mappingcolumn and filtering by Cabinet on the Class column.View Cabinet Live Chart readings by opening a cabinet page and selecting the Live Charts icon inthe toolbar.Access a cabinet page from the Items List: From the Items List under the Assets tab in the Web Client double-clickon a cabinet.Access a cabinet page from the Floor Maps page:Under the Visualization tab, select Health Map from the Reports drop-down.Double-click on cabinet in a floor map or in the Items List.Drill down to Cabinet Live Charts on a cabinet page from a Health Map via the cabinet's Enterprise Health page -To access the Enterprise Health page, hover your mouse over the Dashboard tab, then select Enterprise Healthwhen the menu opens.To open a location's Health Floor Map from the Enterprise Health page, click on the location's tile.The Health Floor Map for that location opens in a Floor Map view.Click on a cabinet in the floor map or Items List. Its Health Details automatically expands on the right of the page.Click the Expand/Collapse icon in that section if it does not display automatically.Click the name of the cabinet in Health Details - the name is a link to the cabinet page.The cabinet's page opens and the Cabinet Live Charts are displayed by default.

This chart provides the active power trend for the cabinet's power and the cabinet capacity limit. The amount of stran-ded power, if any, is noted at the bottom of the chart in red.This section allows you to select two rack PDUs in your cabinet to compare their power or current trends at the out-let, breaker and inlets levels.The Cabinet Live Charts autoselect the first two rack PDUs in your cabinet. If you have more than two rack PDUs inthe cabinet, use the pulldown to select the rack PDU you want to see in the left chart and the one in the right chart.

In order to focus on a specific breaker or inlet, you can select a breaker or inlet from the legend to add or remove itfrom the view.Cabinet events, such as Cabinet Threshold events, and cabinet content events, such as rack PDU events, are listedin this section. Only Active events are shown.If a large number of events are displayed in the chart, use Search and Filter to narrow results.You can also click the Full Screen button to expand the Cabinet Events chart to the entire size of the charts area, ifneeded.

Link to each Cabinet Live Chart on the page using quick links. These links remain visible no matter what chart youare viewing.This chart provides a summary of the active power trends for the cabinets.View the Average, Maximum or Minimum active power by Month, Week or Day.

Click the Refresh button in each Cabinet Live Chart to refresh the chart and view the latest data.Clicking the Refresh button at the top of the page in the toolbar refreshes the entire page, and all Cabinet LiveCharts at once.Hovering over data point on a chart provides the data series name and data point values for x and y axis.To hide specific data on a chart, click on it in the legend that appears above the chart. For example, hide the Total ITDevice Budget Value by clicking on it in the legend. The data line on the chart is removed.Click on it again to restore it.Click Zoom to zoom in to the lowest value being charted. This is the point on the chart where the y-axis starts andintersects with the x-axis. Zooming out and returning to the default view, shows the chart starting at zero.Trend readings are available for the past day, week or month.Trends are measured as maximum, minimum or average readings.Once you set a chart to display a specific trend for a specified time period, those same settings are applied to all ofthe charts on the page. For example, select Trend = Average for the Day, those same settings are applied to the Out-lets chart, Inlets chart and so on.

Use the Cabinet Inspector to quickly obtain cabinet item totals, available ports, and power data for the cabinet.Cabinet Inspector is accessed from cabinet elevations on every page.It opens in a dialog, you can use the vertical scroll bar to view the information at the bottom. Click Close to close thedialog.In Item List and Floor Map the Cabinet Inspector will always show in the Cabinet Elevation by default. Scroll to thebottom of the Cabinet Elevation to view the Cabinet Inspector.You can click the eye icon in the Cabinet Elevation toolbar if you don't want to view the Cabinet Inspector in theCabinet Elevation.The cabinet totals presented in this panel are based on the items in the cabinet.As items are added, removed and updated, the totals change.For example, the weight increases when an item is added, RU availability decreases and so on.A cabinet's total budgeted power is calculated by adding the budgeted power information for each item in the cab-inet.Budgeted power information is entered automatically based on data from the Item Models Library, or it is enteredmanually when the item is created.This reading is displayed only for items that require power.If redundant power supplies are used, dcTrack does not include the redundant power supply as part of the budgetedpower calculation; only the primary power supply is used in the calculation. This provides an accurate reading sincethe redundant power supplies are not in use.For example:RPDU-P is the primary power supply and RPDU-R is the redundant (backup) power supply for a cabinet.Only RPDU-P is used to calculate the total budgeted watts.Cabinet Inspector readings are not live. Click Refresh to see the most current totals."Budgeted power (W)" - the total budgeted power for cabinet"Heat output" - total BTUs or Kw output per hour from the cabinet"Total weight" - total weight the cabinet in pounds in or kilograms"Items in cabinet" - the total number of items in the cabinet"Available RUs" - the total number of available rack units (front and back)out of the total number of rack units in the cabinet"Largest contiguous RUs" - the largest number of contiguous RUs avail-able in the cabinetNote: The dcTrack® System Administrator configures the units of measure used (US or SI).

As port usage changes, the totals are updated.If no data are listed, no assets with those port types are contained in the cabinet.Ports must exist for items in order for them to be counted in the totals.An item's port information is included when the item is created so long as the port information is included for the itemin the Item Models Library. Ports can also be added manually when the item is created or at a later time.A Types of ports - copper, fiber, coax and power ports. Port totals are broken down by type.B Total number of ports for that port type.C Total number of available ports for that port type.Cabinet Inspector readings are not live. Click Refresh to see the most current totals.Note that in order for connection path information ("Connect to") to be available, the circuit that connects the rackPDU to its power supply must exist in dcTrack.Inlet or Outlet - the name of the inlet or power outlet the rack PDUconnects to"Connect to" - the power path of the upstream power connectionAmps (R/B/M) - the rated, budgeted and measured amps of therack PDU's inlet or power outlet connection. Each line and R/B/Mreading for each is listed for 3-phase rack PDUsSource - the rack PDU's power sourceCabinet Inspector readings are not live. Click Refresh to see the most current totals.

PDUs are the power sources for rack PDUs.The PDU must be part of the power circuit that exists for the rack PDU in order for data to be displayed in this panel.Number of breaker polesThe rated, budgeted and measured amps at the power outlet associatedwith the PDUThe name of the originating PDU's power source, such as a UPS unitName of the sub-panel (if applicable, not shown in the example)Cabinet Inspector readings are not live. Click Refresh to see the most current totals.

The Rules feature does not associate a Rule to a Model. are applied to any Items that qualify based on the Rule'sbuilt in logic and parameters. Based on requirements provided by users, Sunbird Technical Support will provide arule that can be uploaded into the application. The rule is evaluated and applied whenever an item that meets therules criteria is created or updated.Some example use cases include:I need to update PS1 and PS2 budgeted watts based on the Items Location.I need to provide data port comments based on an item’s Location and Function type.You can launch the Rules Builder dialog by clicking the Rules tab on the Field Management page.Any rule that is not marked as disabled will be executed whenever any Item is updated or inserted.When a Rule is selected, its details are displayed in the Rule Details section in the right panel.The screenshot below shows an example of a rule in the Manage Rules dialog based on a requirement to add com-ments to data ports when deploying an item into specific locations with a specific Function type.The Rule Details section includes the following fields:Rule Name: The name of the rule.Enable: Yes or No indicating the Rules current statusDescription: The rule statement, including elements that have been parameterized.Parameters: Values for the parameters in the rule.The rule file provided by Sunbird Professional Services can be uploaded to your system by clicking the Upload but-ton.1. In the Manage Rules dialog, click the Upload button.Once uploaded, you are able to customize the parameters based on any changes in your environments or require-ments.Click the Save icon and button to save your changes.
To delete a rule, select the rule you wish to delete in the Rules Builder and click the Delete button.

You can filter rules by entering the full or partial name of the rule into the filtering bar in the left panel of the RulesBuilder dialog.Please note, while Inserts and Updates will trigger Rules in most cases, for example through the UI, APIs, and FileImport, there are limited functions that will not trigger Rules. These features are listed below:Adding an invalid (incomplete) Item via integrationdcTrack allows you to define relationship between Items. You can set the relationship of any of your Items such asrelates to or other relationship.Steps to Create Item Relationship :1. Navigate to the Asset List page from the Asset menu.2. Double click the row for the Item you want to create Relationship.3. Click Relationship sub tab of Item.4. Click Add a Relationship.5. Provide the following information to create Relationship.a. Relation Type : Select the Relation Type from the drop down. If the Relation Type you are looking fordoes not appear in the drop down option then you can create Relation Type from Field Managementscreen. See here Configuring Options for Single and Multi-Select List for more details. Required.b. Location : Select the Location of the item you wan to create Relationship. You can multi- select Loca-tions from the drop down.c. Item Name : Select the Item Name. The drop down will show the items for the selected Location(s).Required.d. Comment : Optional.6. Click Create.Related Items will appear in the Relationship sub tab.To Delete Item Relationship :1. Navigate to the Asset List page from the from the Change menu.2. Double click the row for the Item you want to delete Relationship.3. Click Relationship sub tab of Item.4. Select one or more Relationships from the list.5. Click Delete.Note : To create and delete Item Relationship, you must have edit permission for the Project.Note: Business Rules that depend on item relationships run for both items when an item relationship is added ordeleted. If the relationships are modified from the item detail page of the item that displays the result of a rule, anitem refresh will be required since this item is neither saved nor refreshed due to the change in relationship.You can also create and delete Item Relationship using File Import /Export. Refer to the examples in the sampleimport template for Item.

The Asset Audit feature is designed to provide an easy way to perform Data Center Audits. Through the use of BarCode scanning and Voice Response, audits can be completed quickly and efficiently by a single user. Upon com-pleting the audit, a summary can be generated and exported for review. After verifying the changes suggested in theexport, simply import this file back into dcTrack to make the actual updates, ensuring your dcTrack applicationalways reflects the actual state of your Data Center.For Bar Code scanning a 1D, 2D or combo 1D/2D scanner is required to be connected (wired or wireless) tothe computer used for the auditIf 2D codes (i.e. QR codes) are used the content of the QR code is expected to be a single value. QR codescontaining multiple values are not supported.Supported Browsers for Text-To-SpeechGoogle Chrome (Windows, macOS)Microsoft Edge (Windows, macOS)Audit Custom Fields. There are 5 Custom Fields that are updated during the Audit Process. These fields mustexist prior to beginning your first Audit. If you do not create them prior to your first Audit, they will be createdautomatically the first time the Audit screen is accessed. When created automatically they are assigned toCabinet, Data Panel, Device, Network, Probe and Rack PDU classes by default.Audit Action - Type TextAudit By - Type TextAudit Date - Type DateAudit Extra Notes - Type Text AreaAudit Remarks - Type Text AreaFor additional information about the Asset Audit feature please refer to the following help topics:Asset Audit ScreenAsset Audit ConfigurationPerforming an Audit SessionCompleting an Audit Session

To access the Asset Audit feature navigate to the Asset Audit Scanning page available from the Asset menu in thedcTrack header tool bar.If this is the first time an Audit is being performed and you have not already created the required Custom Fields, youwill see a message indicating the Custom Fields will be created automatically.Users with any Role can access this feature. If you want to prevent Auditors from being able to make updates on anyother screens, create a User or Group with the Global Viewer Role only, or to limit the User/Group to audits on onlycertain Locations, you can assign the User/Group the Viewer Role at the Location level for only the specific Loca-tions they are allowed to access. If you are limiting Auditors to Viewer access only, you must also grant them specificOperator level Permissions on the Custom Fields required by the Audit. For details about setting permissions onCustom Fields please see Managing Permissions for Custom fields.By default the Asset Audit page is displayed in normal view. To view the page in full screen mode, click the "FocusMode" button in the Asset Audit Scanning tool bar. This will fill your screen with only the Asset Audit page (dcTrackheader menu and browser elements will not be visible and the Focus Mode button will now be labeled "Exit Focus").Performing your audit in Focus Mode is helpful in preventing the screen from accidentally losing focus resulting inthe scanner input being directed to the wrong place. To exit Focus mode you can press the escape key or click the"Exit Focus" button.After selecting a Cabinet, the following buttons become available on the tool bar:Add an Item - Clicking this button will display the necessary fields to Add a new Item to the CabinetFinished Cabinet - Click this button to complete the Audit for the selected CabinetCancel Cabinet - Click this button to cancel the Audit for the selected Cabinet which will erase all previouslyscanned information for the selected Cabinet.To Configure your Audit Session, click the "Configure" button in the Asset Audit Scanning tool bar. This will open adialog box allowing you to define your preferences for the audit session. Once saved, the configuration settings areretained for future Audits.Location - This field is a single-select drop down list of all your dcTrack Locations that "CanContain Assets". By default the selected Location is set to the Users Default Location. If theuser performing the Audit was given access to only certain Locations, the drop down will be pop-ulated with those Locations only. Select the Location of the Cabinet you want to Audit. Only asingle Location can be selected at a time.Field for new Barcodes - This field is a single-select drop down list of all dcTrack Standard andCustom Fields whose Type is "Text". This is the field the scanned barcode will be inserted intowhen a new Item is added. By default the selected field is set to "Asset Tag". Only a single fieldcan be selected.Additional Field - This field is a single-select drop down list of additional fields that can beincluded when adding a new item as part of the Audit.Classes to scan - This field is a multi-select drop down list populated with the 6 classes thatwould be found inside a cabinet. (Device, Network, Probe, Data Panel, Rack PDU, Passive).When searching for Items in a Cabinet, only Items from the selected Classes will be returned.By default all 6 Classes are selected.Mountings to Scan - This field is a multi-select drop down list populated with the currently sup-ported Mountings (Rackable, Non-Rackable). When searching for items, only the items with theselected mountings will be returned. By default both Mountings are selected. Note, additionalMountings will be added in future releases.Orientations to Scan - This field is a multi-select drop down list populated with the currently sup-ported Orientations (Item Front Faces Cabinet, Item Read Faces Cabinet). When searching foritems, only the items with the selected Orientations will be returned. By default both Ori-entations are selected.Clear Audit Fields - This field is a single-select drop down list populated with 7 aging options.This value determines when an existing value in the Audit Action custom field for an item can becleared because it is assumed that this is not from the current Audit effort. By default the "Olderthan 3 Months (90 days)" option is selected.Enable Text-to-speech - Check box field that controls whether dcTrack will read out theresponses to the scans via the computer's speakers.Text-to-speech Voice - This single-select drop down is populated with the different voices/lan-guages that are supported by the browser. This list will vary from browser to browser. When avoice option is changed, the new selection name will be heard. The default voice will be either"Google UK English Female" or "Microsoft Aria Online (Natural) - English (United States)depending on the browser used. This field is disabled if "Enable Text-to-speech" is not selected.Please Note: In the current release, the spoken text is not translated to the languages thatdcTrack supports. This option will be available in a future release.Voice Speed -Enter a number between 0.5 and 1.5 to set the speed of the selected Voice.When the value is changed, the selected Voice is heard at the new speed. By default a speed of1 is set. This field is disabled if "Enable Text-to-speech" is not selected.Read out values - This field is a single-select drop down list populated with combinations of thefields Make, Model, U Position, Rack Units and Status. This controls what is spoken when anitem is found after a scan. By default "U Position, Rack Units" is selected. This field is disabled if"Enable Text-to-speech" is not selected.Clicking "Done" or the X buttons, will close the dialog. All changes made are automatically retained for the durationof the user session in dcTrack. These settings will return to their defaults the next time the user logs in.

Once you have completed the configuration process, you are ready to begin the Audit. Previously set configurationswill remain in effect until either changed by the User, or until the User logs out which will end the current session. Dur-ing the Audit process users may navigate away from the Audit page and return to pick up where they left off.

1. Select the Cabinet to be audited. You can either type the cabinet name into the Cabinet field,select the cabinet from the drop down list of cabinets or if the cabinet has a barcode you canscan the barcode to select the cabinet.Note, if the cabinet selector is bank, any scan input that does not contain special start/end char-acters will be interpreted as the barcode of a cabinet. This code will be used to search for a cab-inet within the selected location. Additionally, scanning input will be ignored while the SelectCabinet drop down is open. Any keyboard strokes will be directed to selecting an option fromthe Cabinet drop down.2. When a code is received, a barcode image is displayed and the Status field displays the text"Received from scanner: ABC" where "ABC" is the received code.Note, the supplied code will be searched for an exact match (surrounded by double quotes)against multiple fields within dcTrack, similar to searching using the Quick Search feature in thedcTrack header. This search will only consider Items of Class Cabinet in either the Planned,Installed, or Storage status.3. If no cabinet is found, "Cabinet not found" is spoken indicating the system is ready to receive anew scan input and the Status field will display "Ready to scan."4. If a cabinet is found, the cabinet will be selected in the drop down, the Cabinet field will becomeread-only, the cabinet elevation is displayed, and the grid is populated with all of the Items con-tained in the cabinet.5. If you wish to cancel processing for the current cabinet click the "Cancel" button in the tool bar.This will erase all previously scanned information for the selected Cabinet.6. If you have finished the Audit for the Cabinet, click the "Finished Cabinet" button in the tool bar.1. Scan an Item in the cabinet. Items can be scanned in any order, top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top orrandomly (random is not recommended as Items could be easily missed).Note, if you are not using a scanner or a barcode is damaged and unable to be scanned, simplytype in the text you want dcTrack to search on and hit Enter. You do not need to reposition yourcursor, dcTrack will automatically direct the input to the appropriate field.2. If the Item is found:The Status field displays: "Received from scanner: xxxxxx, Found Item", where xxxxx isthe scanned code.The image of the barcode is displayed.The Scan Result field will become green and display "Found Item <item name>: U <uposition>. <x> U high". where x is the height of the item in rack units (the Scan Resultfield green background will disappear after a few seconds).The voice will speak the details of the found item based on what was selected in the con-figure dialog for the read out fields.The Adjust U input field will appear and be editable.The cabinet elevation will show the green arrows on either side of this itemThe row in the grid for this item will be selected.If the Item's Status is "Installed", the Audit Action column for this item will display the text"Good" and the Audit Remarks column for this item will display the text "VerifiedInstalled.If the item status is other than installed, the Audit Action column for this item will displaythe text "Update" and the Audit Remarks for this item will display the text "Status toInstalled".3. If the information for the Item is correct, you may move on to scan the next Item in the cabinet.4. If the current U position in dcTrack is not the same as the Items actual location in the cabinet,use the keyboard to correct the U Position or scan one of two barcodes sequentially on theBarCode responses sheet to indicate the U position.The barcodes on the sheet use sepcial start/end charecters. This sheet can be printedand carried with you during the auditThe Word doc contains two columns of barcodes. On the left are 5 barcodes. Scanningone of these codes, indicate that you want to scan a two digit U Position. Therefore, thenext scan is expected to be the second digit of the number. The voice will say "tens" or"twenties", etc.If the u position is 9 or lower, scan a barcode from the code on the right.If you select a U Position that is not available, dcTrack will speak the message "U <xx> isnot available".Note, scanning the U Position values is repeatable without causing issues. You can scanthe first digit code over and over. Only the last code scanned will be used. Once thesecond digit scanned is recieved, re-scanning the second digit code again will changethe u position to a single digit number.5. When the U position value is received the voice will say "Moved to U Position xx"6. "Move to Uxx." is appended to the Audit Remarks for this item and the Audit Action column forthis item will display the text "Update".7. You can now move on to scan the next Item in the Cabinet.

1. Scan an Item in the cabinet. Items can be scanned in any order, top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top orrandomly (random is not recommended as Items could be easily missed).Note, if you are not using a scanner or a barcode is damaged and unable to be scanned, simplytype in the text you want dcTrack to search on and hit Enter. You do not need to reposition yourcursor, dcTrack will automatically direct the input to the appropriate field.2. If the Item is found but located in a different Cabinet:The Status field displays: "Received from scanner: xxxxxx, searching..."The image of the barcode is displayed.The Scan Result field will become red and display "Found in Cabinet <cabinet name>:<x> U high. Set U Position in this cabinet". (the Scan Result field red background will dis-appear after a few seconds).The voice will speak the text in the Scan Result field.The Set U input field will appear and be editable.3. Use the keyboard to set the U Position or scan one of two barcodes sequentially on theBarCode responses sheet to indicate the U position.If you select a U Position that is not available, dcTrack will speak the message "U <xx> isnot available".4. The item will be added to grid and selected.5. If the item status is installed, the Audit Remarks field for this item will display the text "VerifiedInstalled".6. If the item status is other than installed, the Audit Remarks for this item will display the text"Status to Installed".7. The Remarks field is then appended with "Move to U<xx> in <Cabinet name>. From <Cabinetname>.8. The Audit Action will be set to "Move".9. You can now move on to scan the next Item in the Cabinet.1. Scan an Item in the cabinet. Items can be scanned in any order, top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top or randomly(random is not recommended as Items could be easily missed).Note, if you are not using a scanner or a barcode is damaged and unable to be scanned, simply type in thetext you want dcTrack to search on and hit Enter. You do not need to reposition your cursor, dcTrack will auto-matically direct the input to the appropriate field2. If the Item is not found in dcTrack:Status field displays: "Enter or Scan details."The image of the barcode is displayed.The Scan Result field will become red and display"Item not found for code <code scanned>" (the ScanResult field red background will disappear after a few seconds).The voice will speak "Item not found. Enter or scan details"The Add an item fields are displayed.Make - Enter the Make of the Item to be addedModel - Enter the Model of the Item to be addedU Position - Enter the U Position the Item was found at. You may use the BarCode responsessheet to enter the U Position.RUs - Read only field populated with the RU height of the selected Model.Name - dcTrack will automatically populate the Name field using a combination of the CabinetName and UPosition (<cabinet>-<Uposition>). You can overwrite the pre-populated name bysimply typing in the Name field.Scan Field - The final field is based on your Configuration setting. The label will display thename of the field you selected to receive scanned barcodes.While the Add form is displayed, any scanner input is directed to the location of the cursor in any of theAdd Item fields.3. Once all of the Add Item fields are supplied, click the "Add Item" button to add the Item.4. The new Item is added to the grid with an Audit Action of "Add" and the "Audit Remarks" set to "New Item".5. You can now move on to scan the next Item in the Cabinet.

1. In the Asset Auditing Configuration dialog, select Blade in the Mountings dropdown, then click the Done but-ton.2. A new Audit Chassis button appears in the toolbar. You can click the Audit Chassis button at any time toenable you to scan blades. Clicking the Audit Chassis button updates the Asset Audit Scanning screen forscanning blades.Note: If a chassis row is selected in the Items list when you click the Audit Chassis button, the Select aChassis drop-down in the Asset Audit Scanning screen is populated with the selected chassis. If the ScanBlades button is clicked without a chassis selected in the Items list, the Select a Chassis dropdown will beblank and editable, listing all chassis in the selected cabinet. If the Audit Chassis button is clicked without acabinet selected, the Select a Chassis dropdown will be blank and editable, listing all chassis in the location.3. Alternatively, click the Barcode button in the toolbar on the Items List and select the Audit Cabinets andChassis option.4. To finish the chassis, click the Finished Chassis button.Note: When you click the Finished Chassis button, any unscanned blades in the chassis are marked for removaland the screen returns to the Cabinet Scanning view as it was before entering blade scanning mode (the previouslyselected cabinet is still selected, its items are in the list, the chassis that was selected is still selected, and all auditactions, remarks, and extra notes are intact.1. In the Asset Audit Configuration dialog, select Zero-U mounting in the Mountings dropdown, then click theDone button.2. After you select a cabinet containing Zero-U items, the Zero-U items display in the items grid. The Rails Usedcolumn also becomes the Rails/Side column. A new Orientation/Depth column displays in the grid and dis-plays the Orientation for a Rackable item and the Depth Position for a Zero-U item.3. When a scanned barcode matches a Zero-U item in the cabinet, the voice response also provides the cabinetside and the depth position.4. After a scanned Zero-U item is found, you can adjust its U position, cabinet side and depth position. Whenscanning the cabinet is finished and a Zero-U item was not scanned, it is marked for removal.5. When scanning the cabinet is finished and a Zero-U item was not scanned, it is marked for Remove.

dcTrack enables you to scan items that are not in cabinets, such as free-standing items and items on a pallet or ashelf in a storage room. This feature requires you to have a permission level that allows you to add new items andedit existing items. (e.g., Global Operator or Operator in a location.).To use this feature, you first need to create a Scan Group of all the items that you want to scan to verify that theitems in the group in dcTrack are the same items that physically exist in your location and that the number of items isthe same.1. Create a scan group:a. Filter the items list by one location.b. Then filter the list by a field that all the items have in common, such as a custom field2. Click the Barcode button in the toolbar.3. Select the Audit a user-defined Scan Group option4. If you select the Audit a user-defined group option without first creating a scan group. dcTrack displays aprompt with instructions for how to use the feature.5. If you scan an item that is not found, dcTrack allows you to add a new item with the following information:MakeModeltem name6. The new Item will be added to the scan group item list7. When all Items in the group have been scanned, click the Finish group button to finish the group. To cancelthe group, click the Cancel group button.Once you have scanned all of the Items in the Cabinet, you are ready to complete the scanning session for theCabinet. If instead you would like to cancel the audit, you can select the "Cancel Cabinet" button in the tool bar. Youcan cancel the Cabinet at any time during the audit session, however please note, canceling the cabinet will eraseany previously scanned information for the selected Cabinet.

1. To complete the Audit session click the "Finished Cabinet" button in the tool bar.2. If there are Items in the dcTrack Cabinet that have not been scanned, you will receive a message indicating ifyou proceed, the Item's Audit Remarks will be updated to "Remove from Cabinet". You may chose to con-tinue by clicking "Yes, I am sure", or return to the audit session by clicking "No, I'll double check". PlannedItems that have not been scanned will not be removed from the cabinet.3. If you chose to proceed, dcTrack will begin processing each Item in the Cabinet. When complete the detailsfor each Item are displayed below the progress bar. You can scroll through the details to view each item, orhover over the Progress Details field to display them as a tool tip.4. During processing, the values for each of the 5 Audit Custom fields is updated on each Item to reflect the val-ues from the Audit.5. For all newly added items, their notes are added to the custom fields of the cabinet since the Items don't yetexist in dcTrack.6. When processing is complete, the Select Cabinet field is cleared and is once again editable.7. You can now select another Cabinet to begin a new Audit session.The results from the previous Audit will remain available on the page until a new Cabinet is selected8. Audit Custom Fields should now appear updated for each Item processed during the AuditVerified ItemItem moved to different U Position in the same CabinetItem moved from a different CabinetItem not found in physical CabinetTo apply the resultd of the audit, see Apply Audit ResultsAfter completing a new asset audit of items in a cabinets or in a chassis, a user with permissions to update the itemcan apply the audit results from the bar code menu on the items list to make the changes:1. Filter the Items list by Audit Date.2. Select the cabinets and all other items that were audited.3. Click the bar code menu icon on the items list and select Apply Audit Results.4. The changes are processed immediatelyNote: The update will process items that are in the Installed status and need to be moved to another cabinet by issu-ing a Move Request. If Request Bypass is enabled before you select Apply Audit from the bar code menu, thisrequest will complete. If it is not enabled, the request will be issued and a "WhenMoved" item will be created foreach item moved.

dcTrack 8.2.0 introduced new classes to track the inventory associated with all the equipment typically found in the“gray space” from the Commercial Utility feed and Emergency Generators down to the distribution level includingswitchgear and switchboards, transformers, and power panels (panelboards).dcTrack 9.0.0 includes enhancements to these Facility Items to allow you to capture additional details specific toeach Power Source (see table below) as well as support for Power Ports and Connections.Before configuring Items, you should create the Models for the Facility Item Classes and Subclasses. While dcTracksupports Facility Items, currently you must create the Models for these Classes/Subclasses manually. Libraryupdate does not create Models for these Classes/Subclasses.Note : After upgrading to 8.2.0 all existing CRAC items and models will be migrated to Class HVAC subclass Cool-ing Unit and CRAC Group will be called Cooling Zone.AC Distribution Class is broken into following subclasses.Switch - Item representing Switch Gears, Switch Boards, ATSLoad Device - Large breakers found in a switch gear that has both inputs and outputs allowing connections toother itemsOther Device - Other type of Load DevicePower Panel - Component that splits a power feed into secondary circuits, while simultaneously providing aprotective circuit breakerTransformer - Used to step up (increase) or step down (decrease) the voltage levels before distributing it tothe next circuitAC BayUPS Bank - Sister subclass to the Switch, fed from UPS and downstream to PDUs

Power Source Class is broken into following subclasses.Generator - supply backup power when utility power goes outFuel Tank - Used to store fuel for the generatorUtility Feed - Independent electrical feed coming into a data center from the utility companyHVAC Class is broken into following subclasses.Cooling Unit - Previously called CRACCooling Zone - Previously call CRAC groupHeat Rejection - Covers other cooling objects such as chillers, condensers and water towersThese new fields can be found on the Configuration sub tab of each Class/Subclass Item Detail page.Power Source AC DistributionTankSize (gal-Fuel Tanklon)RatingGenerator, Utility Feed Transformer(kVA)RatingGenerator, Utility Feed(kW)RatingUPS Bank, Switch, Load Device, PowerGenerator, Utility Feed(A)PanelDerateGenerator, Utility Feed Load Device, Power Panel80%RatingGenerator, Utility Feed UPS Bank, Switch, Load Device(Vac)PhaseVolts,Transformer, Power PanelOutputVoltsOutputGenerator, Utility Feed UPS Bank, SwitchWiringPhaseTransformer, Power Panel, Load DeviceOutputTransformerPhaseWireGenerator, Utility Feed Load Device, TransformerGaugeWirePower PanelColorsSpeedGenerator(RPM)Built-inTankGeneratorSize (gal-lon)Con-nectorLoad DeviceTypeI.C Rat-Load Device, Power Paneling (kA)NumberPower Panelof PolesPanelPower PanelLayoutPowerFedLoad Device, Transformer, Power PanelFromPoleNum-Power PanelberingFirstPolePower PanelNumberActiveState,Pre-Load DeviceferredStateDeviceLoad DeviceNumberFor Additional Information please see the following topics:Configuring Facility ItemsConnecting Facility Items

dcTrack version 9.0.0 introduced the ability to configure Facility Items where applicable. The Item Detail page forthese Items will now contain a "Configuration" subtab with the specific configuration detail for the Item.Configuring AC Distribution Class ItemsPower PanelUPS BankLoad DeviceSwitchTransformerConfiguring Power Source Class ItemsFuel TankGeneratorUtility FeedConfiguring DC Power Class ItemsRectifierPlantPlant PanelThe following fields are available for configuration on Distribution Class Items:Power PanelSteps to configure a Power Panel1. Navigate to the Item Detail page of an AC Distribution/Power Panel Item2. Click the Configuration subtabClass/Subclass : Drop down list for selecting the Class the Power Panel will be fed from.GeneratorUtility FeedPower PanelLoad DeviceTransformerFed From: Item name of the Item the Power Panel will be fed fromWhile none of the fields on this subtab are required to create a Power Panel Item, at a minimum you must supply thefollowing fields before you can connect this Item.Class/SubclassFed FromPhaseRating (A)For additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.SwitchSteps to configure a Switch1. Navigate to the Item Detail page of an AC Distribution/Switch Item2. Click the Configuration subtabWhile none of the fields on this subtab are required to create a Switch Item, at a minimum you must supply the fol-lowing fields before you can connect this Item.Rating (A)Output WiringThe Nameplate value is read only and will be inherited from the Models Rating.After configuring the Switch you can add Load Devices. To connect a load device from the Switch Devices subtabselect a row while in Edit mode and click the Connect button.For additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.UPS BankSteps to configure a UPS Bank1. Navigate to the Item Detail page of an AC Distribution/UPS Bank Item2. Click the Configuration subtabWhile none of the fields on this subtab are required to create a Switch Item, at a minimum you must supply the fol-lowing fields before you can connect this Item.Rating (A)Output WiringThe Nameplate value is read only and will be inherited from the Models Rating.As UPS Units are added to the Bank they are displayed in the UPS Units list.After configuring the UPS Bank you can add Load Devices. To connect a load device from the Switch Devicessubtab select a row while in Edit mode and click the Connect button.For additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.Load DeviceThere are several ways to configure a Load Device.1. Adding an AC Distribution/Load Device Item by clicking "Add an Item"2. From the "Switch Devices" subtab of an AC Distribution/UPS Bank by clicking the "Create Switch Device" but-ton3. From the "Switch Devices" subtab of an AC Distribution/Switch by clicking the "Create Switch Device" buttonWhile none of the fields on this subtab are required to create a Switch Item, at a minimum you must supply the fol-lowing fields before you can connect this Item.Item Subclass: This is the Item Subclass the Load Device will be Fed From. (UPS Bank, Switch)Item Name: Drop down list box populated with qualifying Items based on the Subclass selectedRating (A)Line Side: How the Load Device connects upstream (Upstream equipment that is feeding the Load Device.Options Are: Bus A, Bus B, Bus C or Ext.If Ext (External) is selected you will be prompted for the Class of the Upstream Item you want to con-nect. This will populate the Fed From drop down with all qualifying Items and their power ports.Appears above the main breaker on a single line diagramLoad Side: How the Load Device connects downstream. Appears below the main breaker on a single line dia-gramOptions are: Bus A, Bus B, Bus C or ExtIf Ext (External) is selected, you must make the connection from the Item you want to connect.For additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.TransformerSteps to configure a Transformer1. Navigate to the Item Detail page of an AC Distribution/Transformer Item2. Click the Configuration subtabWhile none of the fields on this subtab are required to create a Transformer Item, at a minimum you must sup-ply the following fields before you can connect this Item.Class/SubclassFed FromPhaseRating (A)Class/Subclass : Drop down list for selecting the Class the Power Panel will be fed from.GeneratorUtility FeedPower PanelLoad DeviceTransformerFed From: Item name of the Item the Transformer will be fed fromFor additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.

The following fields are available on the Configuration subtab of Power Source Class Items:Fuel TankSteps to configure a Fuel Tank1. Navigate to the Item Detail page of an Power Source/Fuel Tank Item2. Click the Configuration subtabNameplate (Gallons): Inherited from the Model.Feeds a GeneratorFor additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.GeneratorSteps to configure a Generator1. Navigate to the Item Detail page of an Power Source/Generator2. Click the Configuration subtabRating (kVA): RequiredRating (kW): RequiredRating (A) : Required before item can be connectedRating (Vac): RequiredOutput Wiring: RequiredFeeds the following Items:AC Distribution/Power Panel (inlet)Switch (Line Side)Load Device (Line Side)TransformerUPS Inlet/UPS BypassRectifierFor additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.Utility FeedSteps to configure a Fuel Tank1. Navigate to the Item Detail page of an Power Source/Utility Feed Item2. Click the Configuration subtabRating (kVA): RequiredRating (kW): RequiredRating (A) : Required before item can be connectedRating (Vac): RequiredOutput Wiring: RequiredFeeds the following Items:AC Distribution/Power Panel (inlet)Switch (Line Side)Load Device (Line Side)TransformerUPS Inlet/UPS BypassRectifierFor additional information see the topic on Connecting Facility Items.The table below is a general overview of the rules for connecting Facility Items.Fed From Class/Subclass FieldsClass/Sub-Gen-Util-ACSwitc-UPSTrans-FloorUPSPlantDCclass of theeratorityDis-h /BankformerPDU/Po-Out-PanelPanelItem you areFeedtrib. /Load/(Output)werputBranc-Branc-onPowerDevic-LoadPanelhhPaneleDevic-BranchBreak-Break-Branc-(LoadebreakerererhSide)(LoadBreak-Side)erAC Dis-Y Y Y Y Ytrib./PowerPanel (Inlet)Switch/LoadDevice (LineY Y Y Y YSide)UPSBank/LoadYDevice (LineSide)TransformerY Y Y Y Y(Input)Floor PDUY Y Y(MainBreaker)UPSInlet/UPSY Y Y Y YBypassRectifierY Y Y Y Y(Input)DC PanelY Y(Inlet)How to read the tableAn Item of the Class/Subclass in the first column on the left can be Fed From an item of the Class/Subclass inthe header row where the cell has a Y.In other words, when the item detail page you are on is for an item of the class/subclass from the first columnon the left in the table below, that item’s Fed From field will only allow you to choose an item of the Class/Sub-class in the Header Row where there is a Y in that cell.Example:

If Item A is being fed from Item B where Item A correspond to a row and Item B corresponds to a column, in the tableabove:Voltage of A = Voltage of BIf Phase of A is Wye then Phase of B is WyeIf Phase of A is Delta then Phase of B is Wye or DeltaIf Phase of A is Single Phase (3-Wire) then Phase of B is Single Phase (3-wire)If Phase of A is Single Phase (2-Wire) then Phase of B is Single Phase (3-wire) or (2-wire)Amps of A <= Amps of BUtility Feeds and Generator Items are always at the top of the power chain. This means they do not get fed fromanother item but rather they feed to other items. Therefore, you cannot connect these items from their item detailspages. To connect them, you should go to the item details page of the item it feeds, such as a Transformer, or aSwitchgear Load Device. From there, look for the “Class/Subclass” and “Fed From” fields in the Configuration sub-tab. Set the Class/Subclass to Power Source/Utility Feed or Power Source/Generator and then select the appro-priate item from the Fed From dropdown.If you don’t find the item you want to connect to, check the Volts, Phase and Amps ratings of both items to ensurethat they follow the rules defined above in section “The general rules for connecting Items”

A Load Device represents an input or output connection point for the Switchgear. Load Devices can also be used toconnect multiple Busbars within the Switchgear, if they exist. These are often referred to as Mechanical Tie Break-ers.Input Load Devices:To set up a Load Device as an input, go to the Line Side/Load Side form in the Configuration sub-tab and select “Ext”for the Connects to radio button under Line Side. This will reveal the Class/Subclass and Fed From fields where youcan select the item that this load device is fed from. Then select Bus A radio button for the Connects to field of theLoad Side. When a Load Device is set up this way, it will appear above the “Bus A” horizontal line within theSwitchgear in the Single Line Diagram.When needed, Bus B or Bus C can be selected depending on the configuration of the Switchgear busbars andwhere this particular Load Device is installed.Output Load Devices:To set up a Load Device as an output, go to the Line Side/Load Side form in the Configuration sub-tab and selectBus A radio button for the Connects to field of the Line Side. When a Load Device is set up this way, it will appearbelow the “Bus A” horizontal line within the Switchgear in the Single Line Diagram.When needed, Bus B or Bus C can be selected depending on the configuration of the Switchgear busbars andwhere this particular Load Device is installed.Then select “Ext” for the Connects to radio button under Load Side. Note that being an output this load device is notconnected to the item it feeds from this page. Proceed to the item it connects to and from there, use the Fed Fromfield to select this Load Device.Busbar Tie Load Device:When multiple busbars exist in the Switchgear, set up a Load Device to connect them to each other by selecting oneof the busbars in the Line Side and the other in the Load Side.dcTrack version 8.1.0 introduced the Infrastructure Project Management. This feature allows users to plan projectsby estimating costs, start and end dates and resource requirements. You can track and manage any type of infra-structure project, like site migration, new sit or cabinet row build outs, asset decommissions, new server and con-nection installations or any other infrastructure project.Please refer to the topics below for complete details about this feature and the steps involved in managing your pro-jects.Project ListProject Custom FieldAdding and Managing ProjectAssigning Items to ProjectAssigning Circuits to ProjectRequest and Work Order for ProjectProject RelationshipProject Audit TrailImporting and Exporting Project

To access Project List, go to Change Tab -> Projects.This list contains a row for each Project created in dcTrack. Every field applicable to a Project is available on thegrid. You can Show or Hide using the Show/Hide icon in the upper right corner of the grid. Fields in the grid can berepositioned by dragging and dropping the column to the desired position. Each field is filterable and sortable fromthe column header.The Project List can also be exported to a .csv file by selecting the appropriate export option from the Export buttonon the tool bar.After upgrading to 8.1, all the projects created in prior release will appear in this list. This list will be empty if there areno projects created in your dcTrack database.Add a Pro-Opens a new page to add a ProjectjectView Opens one or more selected projects in View modeEdit Opens one or more selected project in Edit modeClone Creates a new project by cloning the selected projectDelete Deletes the selected ProjectsRefresh Refreshes the Project ListDrop down that allows users to export Projects list exactly as shown or export the export the projectExportinto an import templateShare Generates a share link to the current Project List viewShow inNavigate to filtered item list containing the items assigned to selected projects in the listAssetsShow inNavigate to filtered circuit list containing the circuits assigned to selected projects in the listCircuits

The Project Management feature allows you to create and manage Custom Fields that are specific to only Project,or can also apply to Items, Circuits or parts. Custom Fields enable organizations to capture and display additionaldata that may not be covered by dcTrack's Standard Fields.Users with the System Administrator role or who have the Field Management Operator auxiliary role can add, edit,and delete Custom Fields.Steps to add Project Custom Fields:1. Navigate to Settings > Field Management2. Click the Custom Fields Subtab3. Click the Add a Custom Field button4. Once clicked dcTrack displays the input fields in the tool bar5. Specify the following information in the input fieldsa. Custom Field Label - The name of the Custom Fieldb. Applies To - Select one or more options to specify what the Custom Field applies toItemCircuitPartProjectc. Classes - Select the classes the Custom Field is valid for. Depending on the "Applies To" options youselected, you can select multiple classes including Part, Item, Power and Data Circuits.d. Type - Select the data type of Custom Field.6. Click the Add button in the tool bar to add the Custom field or you may click the Cancel button to disregardyour most recent entry and close the tool bar.The grid below the tool bar will list all existing Custom fields.

Inline editing is supported for the Custom Fields grid, so authorized users can simply select the cell they want to editto make changes to Custom Fields.Steps to Edit Project Custom Fields:1. Navigate to Settings > Field Management2. Click the Custom Fields Subtab3. Click the cell that you want to edit. The grid will allow you to make changes directly to the cell content by typ-ing in the cell or selecting new values from the available lists.4. Your changes will save automatically once you have completed your edits and exited the cell.1. Navigate to Settings > Field Management2. Click the Custom Fields Subtab3. In the Custom Fields tab, select the Custom Fields that you want to delete.4. Click the Delete icon.Note: If the Custom Field is not in use, it will be deleted, however, if the field is in use, dcTrack will display a dialogasking you to confirm the deletion before proceeding.

System Administrators and Field Management Operator can customize Custom Field sub-tab layouts for use on Pro-ject detail page, including adding, editing, and deleting panels and the Custom Fields assigned to each panel. TheProject detail page support up to 99 Custom Field sub-tab. Please refer to Configuring Custom Field Panels for com-plete details on designing Custom Field Panels.

System Administrators and Field Management Operator can specify single-select and multi-select pick lists amongthe types for Custom Fields. Once one of these list types is selected, you can create, edit, and delete the options foreach list. For more information, see Configuring Options for Single and Multi-Select List Types.Users with the System Administrator role can add, edit, delete Custom Fields, their properties, and their list contentsvia bulk import. All other users require both the Field Management Operator and Bulk Import auxiliary roles to add,edit, delete Custom Fields list contents via bulk import.To add, edit, or delete Custom Fields and their properties in bulk via CSV Import/Export:1. On the Custom Fields tab, select the Export icon > Export into an Import Template OR Download Import Tem-plate option.2. If exporting into an import template, the only option to select is Custom Fields to export all fields.3. Save the file in your desired location with the desired file name.4. In the resulting CSV file, make your changes following the instructions provided in the CSV file.5. Save your changes.6. Back in the dcTrack UI, click the Import icon to import the updated file into dcTrack.Note: Custom Fields that are applicable to different Object types are exported as two rows in the file.

Projects can be added via the Web Client, imported using the File Import feature or using API . You need to haveSystem Administrator or gatekeeper role to add and manage project.Steps to Add a Project:1. Navigate to the Add a Project page from the from the Change Menu or select the Add a Project button on theProjects List tool bar. Provide following information in New Project Tab.2. Project Number - Enter the Project Number or leave blank to auto generate. Project Number should beunique.3. Project Name - Enter the Project Name.4. Project Description - Enter the Project Description.5. Location - Select the Project Location. The default selection is the default location set by user in user pref-erence setting. The Location entered here is the Primary Location for the Project. User with the location levelpermission need to have the permission for selected location to access this project. However the you canassign items from other locations to this project.6. Estimated Cabinets - Enter the number of Estimated Cabinets for this Project. This field accepts negativenumber as well. You can enter negative number when the project is for cabinet decommission.7. Estimated RUs - Enter the number of Estimated Rack Units for the Project. This field accepts negative num-ber as well. You can enter negative number when the project is for items decommission.8. Estimated kW - Enter the number of Estimated Power in kW for the Project. This field accepts negative num-ber as well. You can enter negative number when the project is for item decommission.9. Assigned Cabinets - Read Only. This field displays the number of Cabinets assigned to the Project.10. Assigned RUs - Read Only. This field displays the number of rack units assigned to the project.11. Assigned kW - Read Only. This field displays the Power measured in kW assigned to the project.12. Remaining Cabinets - Read Only. Calculated from subtracting assigned from estimated.13. Remaining RUs - Read Only. Calculated from subtracting assigned from estimated.14. Remaining kW - Read Only. Calculated from subtracting assigned from estimated.15. Estimated Items Cost - Enter the Estimated Items Cost for the Project.16. Quoted Items Cost - Enter the Quoted Items Cost for the Project.17. Actual Items Cost - Read Only. Calculated from adding the Purchase Price and Contract Amount of all itemsassigned to the Project. If there are Parts assigned to the items, Parts Purchase Price is also included in thecalculation.18. Estimated Misc Cost -Enter the Estimated Misc cost for the Project.19. Quoted Misc Cost - Enter the Quoted Misc Cost for the Project.20. Actual Misc Cost - Enter the Actual Misc Cost for the Project.21. Estimated Start Date - Select or type the Estimated Start Date for the Project.22. Estimated End Date - Select or type the Estimated End Date for the Project. Estimated End Date can not bebefore Estimated Start Date.23. Actual Start Date - Select or type the Actual Start Date for the Project.24. Actual End Date - Select or type the Actual End Date for the Project. Actual End Date can not be beforeActual Start Date.25. Status - Select the Status for the Project.26. Substatus - Select the Substatus for the Project.Note : Pick list Choices for the Status and Sub Status fields can be configured.
