The list below is in the suggestedorder you should follow when setting up your Parts Management module.Enabling and Disabling the Parts Management FeaturePart ClassesPart Custom FieldsParts ActionsParts LibraryParts ListAdding and Maintaining Parts InventoryImporting and Exporting Parts Inventory and AssignmentsAdjusting Parts StockTransferring Parts InventoryAssigning and Unassigning Parts to ItemsAssigning Parts to Item PortsPart TransactionsTo enable the Parts Management feature:1. Navigate to Settings > dcTrack Settings > Application Administration > Application.2. On the Parts Management panel, select the "Enable Parts Management" check box.3. The Parts Management setting is saved immediately.When this feature is enabled, dcTrack will include two new menu options under the main Settings menu for "PartsLibrary" and "Parts Field Management". Click the Parts Library menu option to navigate to the Parts Library list. Thisis where you can create and update the Parts Models that will be used to create your Parts Inventory. Click the PartsField Management option to navigate to the pages used to manage Part Classes and Part Custom Fields.In addition to the menu options under Settings you will also have three new menu options under the main Assetsmenu for "Parts List", "Add Part(s)" and "Parts Transactions". These menu options provide access to the pages usedto manage your actual Parts Inventory and view the Transactions applicable to each Part.

To disable the Parts Management feature:1. Navigate to Settings > dcTrack Settings > Application Administration > Application.2. On the Parts Management panel, uncheck the "Enable Parts Management" check box.3. The Parts Management setting is saved immediately.When the feature is disabled, the options specific to Parts Management on the Settings and Asset menu will nolonger be available. Additionally you will no longer be able to Assign new Parts to Items or view existing Assign-ments.The Parts Management feature allows you to create and manage user defined Classes specific only to Parts. Similarto Item Classes, Part Classes provide a logical grouping of the Parts in your inventory. While you can create asmany Part Classes as you require, dcTrack is delivered with 8 Part Classes as part of the feature. These Classescan be modified or deleted as needed.CPUHard DriveMPO CassetteNICPower SupplyRAMSFPDaughter BoardSteps to manage Part Classes:1. Navigate to Settings > Parts Field Management2. Click the Add a Class button3. Once clicked dcTrack displays the input fields in the tool bar4. Specify the following information in the input fieldsa. Part Class Label - User defined label used to identify the Part Class. This Label will appear in all PartClass drop down boxes.b. Assignment Level - Select the Item level at which Parts for this Class can be assignedItem Level - Parts can only be assigned to ItemsData Panel Port - Parts can be assigned to specific Data Ports on Items whose Item Class isData PanelData Port - Parts can be assigned to specific Data Ports on any Item Class that supports DataPortsPower Supply Port - Parts can be assigned to specific Power Supply Ports on any Item Classthat supports Power SuppliesSFP - Parts can be assigned to specific Data Ports whose Connector type is SFP on any ItemClass that supports Power Suppliesc. Item Classes - Select one or more Item Classes to which this Part Class can be assigned. Note, if youhave the DC Power feature enabled, in addition to AC Power Classes, this list box will include the DCPower Classes.5. Click the Add button in the tool bar to add the Part Class or you may click the Cancel button to disregard yourmost recent entry and close the tool bar.The grid below the tool bar will list all existing Part Classes and is in-line editable. The only column that may not bemodified is the "Number of times in use". This column displays the number of Part Models that exist in the PartsLibrary for each Part Class.Note, Part Classes with a Number of times in use that is greater than 0 can not be deleted. Additionally, the Assign-ment Level and Item Classes can not be modified to exclude an entry if Part Models have been created for the PartClass that include that Assignment Level or Item Class.

The Parts Management feature allows you to create and manage Custom Fields that are specific to only Parts, orcan also apply to Items and Circuits. Custom Fields enable organizations to capture and display additional data thatmay not be covered by dcTrack's Standard Fields.Users with the System Administrator role or who have the Manage Lists auxiliary role can add, edit, and delete Cus-tom Fields.Note: Permissions are not supported for Part and Part Model Custom FieldsSteps to add Part Custom Fields:1. Navigate to Settings > Parts Field Management2. Click the Custom Fields Subtab3. Click the Add a Custom Field button4. Once clicked dcTrack displays the input fields in the tool bar5. Specify the following information in the input fieldsa. Custom Field Label - The name of the Custom Fieldb. Applies To - Select one or more options to specify what the Custom Field applies toPartsItemsCircuitsc. Classes - Select the classes the Custom Field is valid for. Depending on the "Applies To" options youselected, you can select multiple classes including Parts, Item, Power and Data Circuits.d. Type - Select the data type of Custom Field.e. Apply to Models - If the "Applies To" you selected includes "Parts", you may indicate the Custom Fieldshould be applied to Part Models by checking the "Apply to Models" check box. Part Custom Fieldsthat apply to Part Models may be placed on the Part Model Custom field subtab that appears on thePart Model detail page as well as the Custom Field subtab that appears on the Part Instance detailpage. Part Model Custom fields that appear on the Part Instance Custom field subtab will inherit thevalue specified at the Part Model level but can be overridden at the Part Instance.6. Click the Add button in the tool bar to add the Custom field or you may click the Cancel button to disregardyour most recent entry and close the tool bar.The grid below the tool bar will list all existing Custom fields.

Inline editing is supported for the Custom Fields grid, so authorized users can simply select the cell they want to editto make changes to Custom Fields.Steps to Edit Part Custom Fields:1. Navigate to Settings > Parts Field Management2. Click the Custom Fields Subtab3. Click the cell that you want to edit. The grid will allow you to make changes directly to the cell content by typ-ing in the cell or selecting new values from the available lists.4. Your changes will save automatically once you have completed your edits and exited the cell.1. Navigate to Settings > Parts Field Management2. Click the Custom Fields Subtab3. In the Custom Fields tab, select the Custom Fields that you want to delete.4. Click the Delete icon.Note: If the Custom Field is not in use, the item will be deleted, however, if the field is in use, dcTrack will display adialog asking you to confirm the deletion before proceeding.

System Administrators can customize Custom Field sub-tab layouts for use on Parts Model Detail and Part Instancepages, including adding, editing, and deleting panels and the Custom Fields assigned to each panel. The Part Modeldetail page and the Part Instance detail page both support a single Custom Field sub-tab. Please refer to Con-figuring Custom Field Panels for complete details on designing Custom Field Panels.

System Administrators can specify single-select and multi-select pick lists among the types for Custom Fields. Onceone of these list types is selected, you can create, edit, and delete the options for each list. For more information,see Configuring Options for Single and Multi-Select List Types.1. Navigate to Settings > Parts Field Management2. Click the Pick List Choices subtab3. Click the Create button.4. The Create bar will display immediately above the Pick List grid.5. In the Create bar, provide the following information:a. Pick List Choice Label: The name of the pick list choice6. Click the Add icon to add the pick list option. Click the Cancel icon to abort creation and collapse the Createbar.7. Option is immediately added to the grid.8. Optional. To reorder the pick list options, select the option you want to reorder and click the Move Up or MoveDown icons until the pick list option is in your desired position or click the "Order Alphabetically" button. Bydefault, new pick list options are positioned at the bottom of the list.Users with the System Administrator role can add, edit, delete Custom Fields, their properties, and their list contentsvia bulk import. All other users require both the Manage Lists and Bulk Import auxiliary roles to add, edit, delete Cus-tom Fields list contents via bulk import.To add, edit, or delete Custom Fields and their properties in bulk via CSV Import/Export:1. On the Custom Fields tab, select the Export icon > Export into an Import Template OR Download Import Tem-plate option.2. If exporting into an import template, the only option to select is Custom Fields to export all fields.3. Save the file in your desired location with the desired file name.4. In the resulting CSV file, make your changes following the instructions provided in the CSV file.5. Save your changes.6. Back in the dcTrack UI, click the Import icon to import the updated file into dcTrack.Note: Custom Fields that are applicable to both Items and Circuits are exported as two rows in the file, one with anObject type of "Item Custom Field" and another with an Object type of "Circuit Custom Field".To add, edit, or delete Custom Fields and their list contents in bulk via CSV Import/Export:1. On the Pick List Choices tab, select the Export icon > Export into an Import Template OR Download ImportTemplate option.2. If exporting into an import template, select one or all lists.3. Save the file in your desired location with the desired file name.4. In the resulting CSV file, make your changes following the instructions provided in the CSV file.5. Save your changes.6. Back in the dcTrack UI, click the Import icon to import the updated file into dcTrack.Note: To delete a Custom Field that is applicable to both Items and Circuits you must include two Delete rows in thefile, one for each Object type. If only one Delete row is included, the Custom Field will only be considered no longerapplicable to that Object type.

The Parts Management feature allows users to determine what updates should happen as a result of a specific activ-ity. This is managed through the definition of Parts Actions. Parts Actions are defined as pick list options for the PartsAction standard field. Parts Actions are applied for every transaction performed through the Adjust Stock function.When assigning Parts Actions users define how the Quantity in Stock and Quantity in Use fields should be updated.Steps to Add Parts Actions:1. Navigate to Settings > Parts Fields Management and click on the Pick List Choices subtab2. Select "Parts Action" from the Pick List Fields3. Click the "Add a Pick List Choice" button in the tool bar4. Supply a Label that will be used to identify the Action5. Select the Action for the "In Stock Quantity"IncreaseDecreaseNo change6. Select the Action for the "In Use Quantity"IncreaseDecreaseNo Change7. Click the Add button in the tool bar to add the optionA value must be supplied for all three fields (Label, In Stock Quantity, In Use Quantity). Each time a Part Action isused in the Adjust Stock function, the In Stock Quantity and In Use Quantity for the associated Part Instance will beupdated based on the options defined for that Action.Note: When using the No Change option, a transaction is created, however no change will be made to the asso-ciated Quantity field.Parts LibraryThe Parts Management feature allows System Administrators to create and maintain a Parts Library of all of the PartModels and their Images in your Parts Inventory. The Part Models in your Library are used when creating your PartsInventory on dcTrack.The Parts Library is a library of templates used when creating Parts Inventory in dcTrack. Each Part Instance youcreate must be based on an existing Part Model.Steps to create a Part Model:1. Navigate to Settings > Parts Library2. Click the Add Parts button in the tool bar to access the Part Model detail page3. Select the Model's Part Class type from the Class drop-down. This list is populated with all of your userdefined Part Classes. (Required)4. Select the Model's Make from the Make drop-down. This list is populated with all of the Makes supported bythe dcTrack Item Models Library. (Required)5. Enter the Model Name for the Part. (Required)6. Enter the Part Number for the Part (Required)Note: The combination of Model and Part Number must be unique across all Parts in the Library7. Optionally enter the following informationDescriptionOEM Part #UPC/SKUHeight (in)Width (in)Depth (in)Weight (lbs)Notes8. Select the Slot Type this Part will occupy. Slot Type is used when assigning the Part to Items. The number ofavailable Slot Types can be defined when creating Item Models. If specified, dcTrack will validate whenassigning a Part to an Item that the number of available slots for the specific Slot Type is not exceeded.9. On the Maintenance sub tab you may enter the following optional dataMade In - Select the Country from the drop down listWarranty Period (Years)10. Select Threshold Contacts. You may select one or more contacts from the list of dcTrack user emailaddresses in the drop down list, or enter valid email addresses for non dcTrack users. Threshold Contactswill be notified by email whenever a Part Instance created for this Model is assigned that results in the Countin Stock for that Part falling below the its specified threshold.11. You can optional add an Image for the Part by pasting it into the Image Panel or uploading an Image file fromdisk.

Existing Parts Inventory are listed on the Parts List page under the Assets tab.This list contains a row for each Parts Instance created to represent current physical Parts Inventory. Every fieldapplicable to a Part Instance is available on the grid. You can Show or Hide fields using the Show/Hide icon in theupper right corner of the grid. Fields in the grid can be repositioned by dragging and dropping the column to thedesired position. Each field is filterable and sortable from the column header.The Parts List can also be exported to a .csv file by selecting the appropriate export option from the Export button onthe tool bar.To view a Part's image select the Part from the grid and click the Part Inspector button in the tool bar.Parts inventory can be added via the Web Client or imported using the File Import feature.

Part instances can represent a single Part in inventory (Individually Tracked) or a group of Parts in inventory (Col-lectively Tracked). Once Part instances are created, the inventory they represent is available to be assigned to spe-cific Items.Steps to Add a Part Instance:1. Navigate to the Add Part(s) page from the from the Asset menu or select the Add Part(s) button on the PartsList tool bar2. Make - Enter the Make into the Make field to receive a pre-populated list of Part Models for the specifiedMake in the Part Model field. Note, the list will only contain the Makes for which you have created valid PartModels3. Model - Select the Model name or Part Number from the list of Parts associated with the Specified MakeNote, you can leave the Make field blank and type in any portion of the Model name or Part Number toreceive a list of Part Models that match the entered criteria4. Tracking - Enter the Tracking type.This indicates whether the Part will be tracked Individually or collectively. Individually Tracked Parts will addonly a single Part to inventory that is then available for assignment. Collectively Tracked Parts allow you toenter a number In Stock and a number In Use. Assignments can be made from a Collectively tracked Partinstance as long as there is quantity left in Stock.5. H x W x D (in) - This is a read only field pre-populated with the value specified in the Part Model.6. Slot Type - This is a read only field pre-populated with the value specified in the Part Model. It is used whenassigning the Part to an Item to limit the assignments to only the number supported by the Item Model.7. Weight - This is a read only field pre-populated with the value specified in the Part Model.8. Serial Number - This field is only displayed for Individually Tracked Part instances. The value entered mustbe unique for all Individual Parts instances created for the Part Model. The combination of Make, Model, PartNumber and Serial Number must be unique within a Storage Location.9. Batch Number - This field is only displayed for Collectively Tracked Part instances. The value entered mustbe unique for all Collective Part instances created for the Part Model. The combination of Make, Model, PartNumber and Batch Number must be unique within a Storage Location. The Batch Number can be left blank,however to adhere to the uniqueness validation, only a single Collectively Tracked Part instance can existusing the same Make, Model and Part Number.10. Description - If a description was provided for the Part Model, it will be defaulted in the Description field, butcan be modified for the instance you are adding.11. Count in Stock - Enter the number of Parts you wish to make available for assignments (Only applicable toCollectively Tracked Part Instances)12. Count in Use - Enter the number of Part assigned but not being tracked on dcTrack (Only applicable to Col-lectively Tracked Part Instances)13. Status - Select the Status you wish to associate with the instance. This list is populated with the previouslycreated user defined statuses14. Storage Location - Select the Location where the In Stock Parts in Stock are stored.15. Location Reference - Enter any additional information related to the Storage location.16. Configuration Subtaba. Date of Manufacture - Enter the Manufacture Date for the Part Instanceb. Threshold - Enter a Threshold for the Part Instance. The Threshold determines the lowest Count inStock value the Instance can reach before email notifications are sent.c. Threshold Contacts - You may select one or more contacts from the list of dcTrack user emailaddresses in the drop down list, or enter valid email addresses for non dcTrack users. ThresholdContacts will be notified by email whenever an Assignment is issued that results in the Count in Stockfor the Instance to fall below the its specified threshold. The Contacts listed at this level will be notifiedin addition to Contacts specified at the Parts Model level.Part instances can be edited to correct or update data after the instance is created. The fields that can be changeddepend on the Tracking type and whether any assignments have taken place on dcTrack.Steps to Edit a Part Instance:1. Navigate to the Part List page from the from the Asset menu2. Double click the row for the record you want to edit, or you can select one or more rows from the list and clickthe Edit button on the tool bar (when editing multiple rows each record will be opened in a separate detailpage tab).3. The following fields can be modified based on Tracking type and Assignment Statusa. Individually Tracked Part with no dcTrack AssignmentsAll fields available when Adding a Part can also be modified.b. Individually Tracked Part with dcTrack AssignmentsSerial Number - Can be modified to a different unique valueDescriptionLocation Referencec. Collectively Tracked Part with no dcTrack AssignmentsAll fields available when Adding a Part can also be modifiedd. Collectively Tracked Part with dcTrack AssignmentsBatch Number - Can be modified to a different unique valueDescriptionLocation ReferenceThresholdThreshold ContactsNote, to update the In Stock and In Use values please refer to the Adjust Stockfeature.

Part instances can be deleted prior to performing Assignments on dcTrack.Steps to Delete a Part Instance:1. Navigate to the Part List page from the from the Asset menu2. Double click the row for the record you want to delete, or you can select one or more rows from the list andclick the Delete button on the tool bar.Note, if any of the selected records have Assignments the Delete button will become disabledThe Parts Management Adjust Stock function is used to make modifications to the "In Stock" and "In Use" values forParts Instances. The Adjust Stock feature works in combination with the user defined Parts Actions defined usingthe Pick List Choices feature to allow you to generate transactions that control updates to the In Stock and In Use val-ues based on your own definitions.dcTrack version 9.0.0 introduced the ability to link a Ticket to the Adjust Stock and Transfer Stock Transactions.Steps to Adjust Stock:1. Navigate to the Part Instance Detail page of the Part Instance you want to Adjust2. Click the Adjust Stock button on the tool bar3. This will display the Adjust Stock dialog window4. Count in Stock - Displays the current In Stock value for the Part Instance5. Quantity - Enter the Quantity you want to adjust by6. Action - Select the Action from the drop down list of available user defined Actions. The selected Action willcontrol how the In Stock and In Use Values are adjusted.7. Reason - Optionally enter the reason for the adjustment. The Reason entered will appear in the generatedTransaction records and can be used for filtering and reporting.8. Project Number - Optionally select an existing Project to link to the transactions. The Project Number willappear in the generated Transactions and can be used for filtering and reporting.9. Ticket Number - Optionally select an existing Ticket to link to the transactions. If a Project has been selected,only Tickets linked to the selected Project will appear in the Ticket drop down box. If no Project is specified,the drop down is populated with all open Tickets. If entered the Ticket Number will appear in the generatedTransactions and can be used for filtering and reporting.10. Tracking Number - Optionally enter a Tracking Number. The Tracking Number will appear in the generatedTransactions and can be used for filtering and reporting.11. Click the Save button to complete the update.Upon saving, the Count in Stock and the Count in Use of the Part Instance will be automatically adjusted based onthe rules associated with the Part Action. The updated values will be immediately reflected in the Part Instancerecord.Note, the Adjust Stock feature will always generate 2 Transactions, one for the In Stock value and one for the InUse value. These Transactions are generated even if the rule for the Action indicates No Change. In this case theChanged From and the Change To values will be the same and will reflect the original value of the record.

The Parts Management Transfer Stock function is used to Transfer all or a portion of the In Stock inventory for a PartInstance from one storage location to another.dcTrack version 9.0.0 introduced the ability to link a Ticket to the Transfer Stock and Adjust Stock Transactions.Steps to Transfer Stock:1. Navigate to the Part Instance Detail page of the Part Instance you want to Transfer Stock from2. Click the Transfer Stock button on the tool bar3. This will display the Transfer Stock dialog window4. Count in Stock - Displays the current In Stock value for the Part Instance5. Quantity - Enter the Quantity you want to transfer. You may enter a value up to the current Count in Stockvalue.6. Transfer To - Select the Location you want to Transfer To from the drop down list of dcTrack Locations.7. Reason - Optionally enter the reason for the Transfer. The Reason entered will appear in the generatedTransaction records and can be used for filtering and reporting.8. Project Number - Optionally select an existing Project to link to the transactions. The Project Number willappear in the generated Transactions and can be used for filtering and reporting.9. Ticket Number - Optionally select an existing Ticket to link to the transactions. If a Project has been selected,only Tickets linked to the selected Project will appear in the Ticket drop down box. If no Project is specified,the drop down is populated with all open Tickets. If entered the Ticket Number will appear in the generatedTransactions and can be used for filtering and reporting.10. Tracking Number - Optionally enter a Tracking Number. The Tracking Number will appear in the generatedTransactions and can be used for filtering and reporting.11. Click the Save button to complete the update.12. Upon Saving, the In Stock value of the current Part Instance will immediately be decreased by the enteredQuantity.13. If the Transfer To Location selected has an existing Part Instance that matches the current Part Instancebased on Make, Model, Part Number and Batch Number, the In Stock value of that existing Part Instance willbe increased.14. If the Transfer To Location selected does not have an existing Part Instance that matches the current PartInstance based on Make, Model, Part Number and Batch Number, you will receive a message indicating anexisting record could not be found and a new Part Instance record will be created in the Transfer To Location.The new record will have the same Make, Model, Part Number and Batch Number as the original Partinstance record. The Count in Stock value of the new record will be set to the entered Quantity.Note, the Transfer Stock feature will always generate 2 Transactions, one for the Transfer From Location and onefor the Transfer To Location. The Action for the Transfer From location will be "Transfer Out". The Action for theTransfer To location with be "Transfer In" for locations where an existing record was found, and "Transfer New" forlocations where a new Part Instance was created as a result of the Transfer.The Parts Management feature allows users to assign Parts inventory to specific Items. Parts Inventory can beassigned to any Item that qualifies based on the Part Class's "Assign To" option and the "Item Class" the Part isapplicable to.Steps to Assign a Part to an Item:1. Navigate to the Item you want to assign Parts Inventory to2. Click on the Parts sub tab at the bottom of the Item Detail page3. Click the Edit button for the Item. This will enable the Assign button on the Parts subtab tool bar4. Click the Assign button to display the Assignment panel.5. When the Assignment panel is displayed you will be positioned in the Model / Part Number field. You canbegin typing in any portion of the Model name or Part Number to filter the list to the Part you want to assign.You can also click on the Make field to enter the make which will filter the Model list to only the Parts that areapplicable to the entered Make.Note, the Model list will only include Models that are valid based on the Part Class's applicability to the ItemClass.6. Select the Part you want to assign. If you select a Part Instance that is tracked Collectively you can enter theQuantity of the Part you want to assign.7. If you enter a Quantity of 1 you can optionally convert the Collectively Tracked Part to an Individually TrackedPart by entering a unique Serial Number. If you do not want to convert the Part Instance to an IndividualInstance simply leave the existing Batch Number and the record will continue to be tracked as part of the Col-lectively Tracked Instance. For Individually Tracked Part Instances a Quantity of 1 and the Part InstanceSerial Number are defaulted and can not be changed.8. Optionally enter the Reason for the Assignment. The Reason entered will appear in the generated AssignTransaction record and can be used for filtering and reporting.9. Optionally select an existing Project to link to the transactions. The Project Number will appear in the gen-erated Assign Transaction and can be used for filtering and reporting.10. Optionally enter a Tracking Number. The Tracking Number will appear in the generated Assign Transactionsand can be used for filtering and reporting.11. Click the Assign button to save the Assignment12. The assigned Parts will be added to the assigned Parts List for the Item. You will see a row in the grid for theQuantity of the Parts assigned

Parts can be Unassigned from a specific Item. Once Unassigned the Part is returned to Inventory and the Quantity ofthe original Part Instance record is increased. The Unassigned Part once again becomes available for future Assign-ments.Steps to Unassign a Part:1. Navigate to the Item you want to assign Parts Inventory to2. Click on the Parts sub tab at the bottom of the Item Detail page3. Select the row(s) you wish to Unassign4. Click the Unassign button in the Parts sub tab tool bar5. You can optionally enter a Reason for the Unassignment in the Unassign dialog window6. Click Ok to complete the Unassignment.7. The Unassigned Part(s) is immediately removed from the Parts gridIn addition to assigning Parts to Items, users can optionally choose to assign Parts to the individual Ports on an Item.Parts inventory can be assigned to an Item's Power Supply Ports, Data Ports, Data Panel Ports and SFP Ports.Parts Inventory can be assigned at these levels based on the Part Class's "Assign To" option and the "Item Class"the Part is applicable to. Parts assigned at these levels must first be assigned to the Item. Once assigned to the Itema list of available parts applicable to the Port Type becomes available in the associated grid.Note, for Parts assignable to SFP ports, the Part does not have to be assigned to the Item first. These Parts can beassigned from a general inventory maintained in the Items Location.Steps to Assign a Part to an Item Power Supply Port:1. Navigate to the Item you want to assign Parts Inventory to2. Click on the Power Supply sub tab at the bottom of the Item Detail page3. Click the Edit button for the Item4. Click in the Power Supply Part field for the Port you want to assign the Part to5. The list is populated with all of the Parts assigned to the Item that can be assigned to a Power Supply Port.For Collectively Tracked Parts that were assigned to the Item with a quantity greater than 1, a row is dis-played for each occurrence of the Part. The list is separated into 2 sections. The first section is for Partsalready assigned to a Port in the Item. The second section is for Parts assigned to the Item but not yetassigned to a Port. Because certain Parts may have multiple slots, a Part that is already assigned to a Portcan be assigned to additional Ports. As such you may select a Part from either section.6. Once you have completed assigning Parts, click the Items Save button to save your changes.Steps to Assign a Part to an Item Data Port Port:1. Navigate to the Item you want to assign Parts Inventory to2. Click on the Data Port sub tab at the bottom of the Item Detail page3. Click the Edit button for the Item4. Click in the Card Part field for the Port you want to assign the Part to5. The list is populated with all of the Parts assigned to the Item that can be assigned to a Data Port. For Col-lectively Tracked Parts that were assigned to the Item with a quantity greater than 1, a row is displayed foreach occurrence of the Part. The list is separated into 2 sections. The first section is for Parts alreadyassigned to a Port in the Item. The second section is for Parts assigned to the Item but not yet assigned to aPort. Because certain Parts may have multiple slots, a Part that is already assigned to a Port can be assignedto additional Ports. As such you may select a Part from either section.6. If the Connector type for the Port is any SFP type, you may also assign an SFP part to the Port7. Click in the SFP Part field for the Port you want to assign the Part to8. The list is populated with all of the Parts assigned to the Item that can be assigned to an SFP Connector. ForCollectively Tracked Parts that were assigned to the Item with a quantity greater than 1, a row is displayed foreach occurrence of the Part. The list is separated into 3 sections. The first section is for Parts alreadyassigned to a Port in the Item. The second section is for Parts assigned to the Item but not yet assigned to aPort. The third section is for SFP Parts that are available in general inventory at the Items Location that havenot yet been assigned. Because certain Parts may have multiple slots, a Part that is already assigned to aPort can be assigned to additional Ports. As such you may select a Part from any section.9. Once you have completed assigning Parts, click the Items Save button to save your changes.Steps to Assign a Part to a Data Panel Item's Data Port:1. Navigate to the Data Panel Item you want to assign Parts Inventory to2. Click on the Data Port sub tab at the bottom of the Item Detail page3. Click the Edit button for the Item4. Click in the Cassette Part field for the Port you want to assign the Part to5. The list is populated with all of the Parts assigned to the Item that can be assigned to a Data Panel Data Port.For Collectively Tracked Parts that were assigned to the Item with a quantity greater than 1, a row is dis-played for each occurrence of the Part. The list is separated into 2 sections. The first section is for Partsalready assigned to a Port in the Item. The second section is for Parts assigned to the Item but not yetassigned to a Port. Because certain Parts may have multiple slots, a Part that is already assigned to a Portcan be assigned to additional Ports. As such you may select a Part from either section.6. Once you have completed assigning Parts, click the Items Save button to save your changes.

To unassign a Part from a Port, while in Edit mode for the Item tab into the Port Part field for the port you are unas-signing. This will display the list of available Parts with the selected Part checked. Clear the check from the Part inthe list and click the Save button for the Item.Existing Parts Transaction are listed on the Part Transaction page under the Assets tab.This list contains a row for each Part Transaction created to represent the following Actions.Assign - Generated when a Part is assigned to a specific ItemDelete - Generated when a Part Instance is deletedReceive - Generated when a new Part Instance is createdTransfer - Generated when the Storage Location is modified for a Part Instance. This transaction type indic-ates the Storage Location was changed on a Part Instance. This is only possible prior to making any dcTrackAssignments for a Part InstanceTransfer In - Generated when a Transfer Stock is performed. Created for the Location the inventory is trans-ferred to.Transfer Out - Generated when a Transfer Stock is performed. Created for the Location the inventory is trans-ferred from.Transfer New - Generated when a Transfer Stock is performed. Created for the new Part instance record cre-ated in the Transferred To Location.Update - Generated when any editable field is modified for a Part InstanceUnassign - Generated when a Part is removed from a specific ItemUser Defined Actions - Generated when the Adjust Stock function is performed. The Action for these trans-action will reflect the label assigned by the user.Every field applicable to a Part Transaction is available on the grid. You can Show or Hide fields using theShow/Hide icon in the upper right corner of the grid. Fields in the grid can be repositioned by dragging and drop-ping the column to the desired position. Each field is filterable and sortable from the column header.The Transaction List can also be exported to a .csv or .pdf file by selecting the appropriate export option from theExport button on the tool bar.

Part Models can be exported from the Parts Library List grid page. Users have Three options when exporting Parts.You can "Export Details into Import Template", "Export Images into a Zip File" or "Export Both Details and Imagesinto a Zip File". When exporting the list into an Import Template, the .csv file will contain a record for each row in thelist with all supported Part columns. The Operation column in the template will be set to "Edit" for each Part Modelrow. When exporting images only, dcTrack will generate a zip file that contains all of the Part Images for the Modelsin the current list in a directory called "Part_Images". When exporting both details and images, dcTrack will generatea zip file that contains a .csv file that contains a record for each row in the list with all supported Part columns and a.zip file that contains all of the Part Images for the Models in the current list in a directory called "Part_Images".Note, when importing Part Models and Images, you should import the image file first followed by the detail file.Parts Inventory and Part Assignments can be exported from the Parts List grid page. Users have two options whenexporting Parts. You can "Export Part List Exactly as Shown" or "Export into an Import Template". When exportingthe list exactly as shown, dcTrack will generate a .csv file that contains a record for each row in the list with just thecolumns available in the current view. When exporting the list into an Import Template, the .csv file will contain arecord for each row in the list with all supported Part columns. The Operation column in the template will be set to"Edit" for each Part Instance row. The file will also contain a row for each Assignment associated with any of theParts.Exactly as ShownImport Template

To import Part Models, Parts Inventory and Part Assignments access the main File Import page by clicking theImport button located at the top of every dcTrack page.You can then select the file you wish to import by clicking the Browse button to begin the upload process.Note, import templates for all object types can be downloaded from the main import page by clicking the appro-priate option from the right side panel.For additional information on using the File Import feature, please refer to the help on Use File Import to Add, EditDelete and Move.

dcTrack provides the ability to create and assign Custom Fields to Items, Item Models, Parts, Part Models, Projects,Tickets, Locations, Data and Power Circuits.System Administrators and users with the Manage Lists auxiliary role can add, edit, and delete Item and Circuit Cus-tom Fields. Additionally they can define list content for standard user-configurable lists and List type custom fields inthe Web Client.Role-based access control is also available for Custom Fields. System Administrators and Gatekeepers with theManage Lists role can create, edit, delete, and manage permissions for Custom Fields.Standard Fields are available by default in dcTrack, while Custom Fields can be added by authorized users.The elements contained in Standard and Custom List type Fields are used to populate drop-downs and menus indcTrack. For example, the Function drop down on Item Detail page is populated using the Item Function Pick List.Custom Fields assigned to Items, Item Models, Projects, Tickets and Locations can be viewed in up to 99 CustomField sub-tabs that can be customized by authorized users. Item Custom Fields can be placed in multiple panels oneach sub-tab in configurations that make the most sense for an organization's users.Custom Fields assigned to either Data or Power Circuits can be viewed on the Circuit Detail page for any Data orPower Circuit.Custom Fields assigned to Parts can be viewed on Part Instance and Part Model Custom Field sub tabs.Custom Fields assigned to Projects can be viewed on Project Custom Field sub tabs.Custom Fields assigned to Tickets can be viewed on Ticket Custom Field sub tabs.Custom Fields assigned to Locations can be viewed on the Location Custom Field sub tabsStandard Fields include default attributes that can be configured as needed so they fulfill your specific requirements.For example, you can add new customers to the Customers Standard Field list contents. Standard Fields are usedacross the dcTrack application.Custom Fields can be used to capture information specific to your data center needs that are not included in dcTrackby default. Item Custom fields appear in the Custom Fields sub-tab on the Item Details page while Circuit CustomFields can be viewed on the Circuit Detail page for any Data or Power Circuit, accessible by clicking the CircuitDetail icon on either the Circuit List or Circuit Trace tool bars.For details on available Standard Fields and how they can be used, see Standard Field Descriptions. For detailson Custom Fields, see Custom Field Attributes, Custom Field Types and Field Management Tabs.Custom Fields can be applied to one or multiple classes including Data and Power Circuits. For example, you cancreate a Custom Field called Installation Date, and then specify if you want to apply that field to one, multiple, or allclasses. You can also specify data types for your Custom Fields for better data integrity and quality control.Note: Upon upgrade to dcTrack 6.3 from a pre-6.0 release, the existing custom fields will be displayed in two panelsin a single Custom Fields sub-tab. Upon upgrade to dcTrack 6.3 from Release 6.0 or later, Custom Fields will dis-play as in the post- 6.0 release.Note: Customize Standard and Custom Fields before you create your first data center locations and add items andconnections for the first time. Add attributes to fields so they are available when you perform an import. This isimportant because dcTrack does not add items to fields during the import. Trying to import information that is not ona field causes errors during the import, and you must manually fix them before that data is added.Standard and Custom Fields can be managed under the Settings tab > Field Management. Only System Admin-istrators and users with the Manage Lists auxiliary role can add, edit, and delete list content for standard user con-figurable lists and list content and type for custom fields.

Only System Administrators and users with the Manage Lists auxiliary role can view, add, edit, and delete Standardand Custom Field content through the Web Client under the Settings tab > Fields Management.Custom Fields can be created for Items, Item Models, Circuits, Part, Part Models, Projects, Tickets and LocationsThe Field Management page contains four sub-tabs:This tab provides options to create and edit Custom Fields, select their classes and types, and view the number oftimes each custom field is in use.To create a Custom Field:1. Click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Custom Fields tab.2. In the Custom Fields tab, click the Create button. The Create bar will display immediately below the CustomFields tab menu.3. In the Create bar, provide the following information:a. Custom Field Label: The name of the Custom Field.b. Applies To: The entitiy(s) the custom field applies toc. Class/Subclass:a. Items and Item Models Class (Subclass): The classes/subclass the Custom Field applies to.Multiple Classes/Subclasses can be selected.b. Parts and Part Models: The Model Class (User defined Part classes)c. Circuits: Data and Powerd. Projects: The applies to will always be Projecte. Ticket: The applies to will always be Ticketf. Location: The Location level the custom field applies to.d. Type: The type of Custom Field. You can only select one type. (see Custom Field Types for a list ofvalid Data Types).4. Click the Add icon to add the Custom Field. Click the Cancel icon to abort creation and collapse the Createbar.To update an existing Custom Field:The Custom Field grid supports inline editing for any editable field. Simply click in the column and make yourchanges. The change is saved upon clicking or tabbing out of the column. The "Number of times in use" valueis not editable. This value is calculated by dcTrack based on the actual number of times a value is supplied fora specific Custom Field.To Delete a Custom Field, select the field in the grid and click the "Delete" button in the tool bar. If the field isnot in use, it is immediately deleted. If the field is in use, you will receive a warning message alerting you tothe number of Items or Circuits that currently have supplied a value for the field. If you choose to continue thefield is deleted and removed from all subtabs.The Custom Field toolbar provides both an Export and an Import feature.The Export feature will export a list of all Custom Fields. Custom Fields that are applicable to both Items and Circuitsare exported as two rows in the file, one with an Object type of "Item Custom Field" and another with an Object typeof "Circuit Custom Field".The Import feature supports the Add, Edit and Delete operations. Custom Fields that are applicable to both Itemsand Circuits must be imported using two rows. Rows whose Object type is "Item Custom Field" may only includeItem classes in the Class column of the file. Rows whose Object type is "Circuit Custom Field" may only include DataCircuit and Power Circuit in the Class column. To delete a Custom Field that is applicable to both Items and Circuitsyou must include two Delete rows in the file, one for each Object type. If only one Delete row is included, the CustomField will only be considered no longer applicable to that Object type.From the Custom Field toolbar System Administrators and Gatekeepers with the Manage Lists role may also man-age permissions for specific Custom Fields. Only users with the appropriate permissions will be allowed to View orEdit Custom Field values.

This tab provides options to add, edit, delete, and reorder the choices for Standard and Custom single-select andmulti-select picklists.To create a new list or update an existing list:Select the field name from the Fields column on the left side of the page. This will populate the grid on theright with any options that currently exist for that field.The grid supports inline editing for any editable field. Simply click in the column and make your changes. Thechange is saved upon clicking or tabbing out of the column. The "Order" field may be changed by selecting arow and clicking the "Move Up" or "Move Down" buttons in the toolbar or you can click the "Order Alpha-betically" button and dcTrack will automatically order the options alphabetically. The "Number of times in use"value is not editable. This value is calculated by dcTrack based on the actual number of times a specificoption is selected.To create a new option click the "Create" button in the tool bar. The fields required for the specific list will dis-play below the tool bar. Once all of the required field values have been supplied, the "Add" button will beenabled. Click the "Add" button to save your changes or click the "Cancel" button to discard. For Standardfields, the required fields will vary and are determined by dcTrack based on the fields purpose. For Customfields, the only required field is "Label".To Delete an option, select the option in the grid and click the "Delete" button in the tool bar. dcTrack will auto-matically reorder the options in the list that appear after the deleted option.The Pick List tool bar provides both an Export and an Import feature. You can export a single list or all lists using theExport feature. The Import feature supports the Add, Edit and Delete operations.This tab provides options for customizing Custom Field subtab layouts for use on Item Detail, Item Model, Part, PartModel, Circuit Detail Project, Ticket and Location pages. Up to 99 subtabs can be created for Items, Item Models,Tickets Projects and Locations with any number of panels on each subtab. There is only a single subtab for Circuit,Part and Part Model Custom fields, however the user may create any number of panels on this subtab.Only panels that contain at least one Custom Field will be displayed on the entity type's Detail pages.Custom fields can only be placed on subtabs for the entity type they belong to:When an Item Custom Field is limited to only specific Class/Subclass, the custom field will only appear on theItem Detail page for Items of that Class/Subclass.When an Item Model Custom Field is limited to only specific Class/Subclass, the custom field will only appearon the Model Detail page for Models of that Class/Subclass.When an Part Custom Field is limited to only specific Class, the custom field will only appear on the PartInstance page for Parts of that Class/Subclass.When an Part Model Custom Field is limited to only specific Class, the custom field will only appear on thePart Model detail page for Parts of that Class/Subclass.When a Location Custom Field is limited to only specific Hierarchy Levels, the custom field will only appear onthe Location Detail page for Locations of that level.When a Circuit Custom Field is limited to a specific Circuit type, the custom field will only appear on the Cir-cuit Detail page for Circuits of that type.Project Custom Fields appear on all Project detail pagesTicket Custom Fields appear on all Ticket detail pages

This tab provides the options to modify whether specific Standard and Custom fields are Required, Hidden, Unique,and assigned a Default Value.Properties can be set for Custom Fields of any entity type.ItemsItem ModelsPartsPart ModelsCircuitsProjectsTicketsLocationsRequired fields require a value to be supplied for all new records added to dcTrack that contain thatfield. dcTrack will allow you to make an existing non-required field required, however it will be neces-sary to supply a value for the field the next time you edit a record containing the field and attempt tosave. Whenever you open a record that is missing data for a Required field, dcTrack will flag thesubtab containing the field.Certain dcTrack Standard fields are always required and can not be changed.Items:MakeModelNameLocationStatusItem ModelsClassSubclassMakeModel NameMountingForm FactorHeightPartsMakeModel/Part NumberTrackingCount in StockStatusStorage LocationPart ModelsClassMakeModelPart NumberLocationsLocation CodeLocation NameLevel in Hierarchy

Unique fields will not allow you to supply a non-unique value for any new records added to dcTrack.dcTrack will allow you to modify a non-unique field making it unique, however if you edit a recordwhose field value is not unique for that field, you will be required to supply a unique value prior to sav-ing the record.Certain dcTrack Standard fields must always be unique and can not be changed.Asset TageAsset TagHidden fields are not displayed in the UI. Custom fields may not be hidden so they do not appear in thegrid list when the Hidden option is selected.The visibility of certain Standard fields will always be controlled by dcTrack and can not be changed.Items:Circuit List IdCircuit List TraceCMDB Integration StatusCreated ByCreated OnH x W x DLast Updated ByLast Updated OnLocationMakeModelNameOriginRequest NumberRequest StageSubclassStatusItem ModelsClassSubclassMakeModel NameMountingForm FactorHeightPartsMakeModel/Part NumberTrackingCount in StockStatusStorage LocationPart ModelsClassMakeModelPart NumberLocationsLocation CodeLocation NameLevel in Hierarchy

Default field values will automatically be populated when adding a new record to dcTrack. Existingrecords are not affected by the Default Value setting. If when adding a new record, you choose to over-ride the Default Value and supply a different value or clear the field, subsequent edits on the record willnot reapply the Default Value.Certain Standard field values are automatically supplied by dcTrack and do not allow you to specify aDefault Value.Asset TagCircuit List IdCircuit TraceCMDB Integration StatusCreated ByCreated OneAsset TagH x W x DNameOriginRequest NumberRequest StageSubclassLevel in HierarchyOnly System Administrators can create, edit, delete, and manage permissions for custom fields bydefault. Gatekeepers will require the Manage Lists in order to access and manage permissions for custom fields.Permissions for custom fields are applied separately from the privileges a user inherits from an item’s parent object.For example, a user with the Operator role on an item may be able to manage that item’s details but not its customfield values, unless the appropriate custom field permissions are provided to the user. A user with the View role onan item and the Operator role on custom fields will be able to edit those custom fields in Edit mode from the ItemsList and Item Details page in the Web Client.Note: A user with the Viewer role on an item and the Operator role on custom fields will be able to edit only the cus-tom fields for which the user has the Operator role.In dcTrack 6.0.1 and above, you can allow users with the Viewer role to make limited edits to select custom fields.For example:A user with a global Operator role has access to edit all items, but you want to limit this user to only be able toedit a few custom fields. In this case, you would assign the user the Operator role on the specific customfields that the user should be allowed to edit.A user is restricted to a local Operator role on a few servers, but you want the user to be able to edit a few cus-tom fields. In this case, you would assign the user the Operator role on the specific custom fields that the usershould be allowed to edit.Note: By default, all users will have the Inherit role for custom fields.The table below summarizes the roles available for custom fields. All roles can be applied to all users and usergroups.Permissions inherited from the parent object. Assigned by default to the All Users group for each customfield upon upgrade to 6.0.0. There is no action required on upgrade to maintain the pre-6.0.0 releasebehavior.InheritIn order to change the behavior of custom fields to explicitly control the users or user groups that canview or operate on the custom fields, remove the Inherit role permission from the custom field andassign either Viewer or Operator roles to users and/or user groups for the custom field.Viewer View-only permissions for the custom field’s value.Operator Create, read, update and delete permissions for the custom field’s value.For more information on permissions for custom fields, see Adding and Deleting Permissions for Custom Fields.

1. In the Web Client under the Settings tab > Fields Management > Custom Fields tab, select the custom fieldwhose permissions you want to edit.2. Click the Permission icon. The Permissions dialog will display.3. In the Permissions dialog box, you can add a permission for the selected Custom Field in the By Object tab:a. To add a permission:i. Select to add the permission to a user or user groupii. Select the user or user group from the dropdowniii. Select the role you want to assign: Operator, Viewer, Inheritiv. Click the Add Permission icon to save the permission or the Cancel icon to abortv. The permission will be displayed in the grid in the Permissions dialog boxb. To delete a permission, select the permission you want to delete in the grid and click the Delete icon. The per-mission will be removed from the grid.For more information on permissions for custom fields, see Managing Permissions for Custom Fields.Custom Fields enable organizations to capture and display additional data that may not be covered by dcTrack'sStandard Fields. This may include information from CMDB, ITSM, BMS, and other third-party systems as well asdata that may be of interest to functional teams, such as Finance.Custom Fields can be created for the following object types:ItemsItem ModelsPartsPart ModelsCircuitsProjectsTicketsLocationsUsers with the System Administrator role or who have the Field Management Operator auxiliary role can add, edit,and delete Custom Fields from the Settings tab > Fields Management page > Custom Fields tab.

1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Custom Fields tab.2. In the Custom Fields tab, click the Create button. The Create bar will display immediately below the CustomFields tab menu.3. In the Create bar, provide the following information:a. Custom Field Label: The name of the Custom Field.b. Applies To: The entitiy(s) the custom field applies toc. Class/Subclass:a. Items and Item Models Class (Subclass): The classes/subclass the Custom Field applies to.Multiple Classes/Subclasses can be selected.b. Circuits: Data and Powerc. Projects: The applies to will always be Projectd. Ticket: The applies to will always be Tickete. Location: The Location level the custom field applies to.d. Type: The type of Custom Field. You can only select one type.4. Click the Add icon to add the Custom Field. Click the Cancel icon to abort creation and collapse the Createbar.Note: The following characters are not supported in custom field labels: a period "." and a single quote " ' ". Usingthese characters in your custom fields labels may result in errors or missing information when using the APIs.Inline editing is supported for the Custom Fields grid, so authorized users can simply select the cell they want to editto make changes to Custom Fields.1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Custom Fields tab2. In the Custom Fields tab, click the cell that you want to edit. The grid will allow you to make changes directlyto the cell content by typing in the cell or selecting new values from the available lists.Your changes will save automatically once you have completed your edits and exited the cell.

1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Custom Fields tab.2. In the Custom Fields tab, select the Custom Fields that you want to delete.3. Click the Delete icon.Note: If the Custom Field is not in use, the item will simple be deleted. However, if the field is in use, dcTrack will dis-play a dialog asking you to confirm the deletion before proceeding.System Administrators can specify single-select and multi-select pick lists among the types for Custom Fields. Onceone of these list types is selected, you can create, edit, and delete the options for each list. For more information,see Configuring Options for Single and Multi-Select List Types.1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Pick List Choices tab.2. In the Pick List Choices tab, click the Create button.3. The Create bar will display immediately above the Pick List grid.4. In the Create bar, provide the following information:a. Pick List Choice Label: The name of the pick list choice5. Click the Add icon to add the pick list option. Click the Cancel icon to abort creation and collapse the Createbar.6. Optional. To reorder the pick list options, select the option you want to reorder and click the Move Up or MoveDown icons until the pick list option is in your desired position. By default, new pick list options are positionedat the bottom of the list.

Users with the System Administrator role can add, edit, delete Custom Fields, their properties, and their list contentsvia bulk import. All other users require both the Manage Lists and Bulk Import auxiliary roles to add, edit, delete Cus-tom Fields list contents via bulk import.To add, edit, or delete Custom Fields and their properties in bulk via CSV Import/Export:1. On the Custom Fields tab, select the Export icon > Export into an Import Template OR Download Import Tem-plate option.2. If exporting into an import template, the only option to select is Custom Fields to export all fields.3. Save the file in your desired location with the desired file name.4. In the resulting CSV file, make your changes following the instructions provided in the CSV file.5. Save your changes.6. Back in the dcTrack UI, click the Import icon to import the updated file into dcTrack.Note: Custom Fields that are applicable to both Items and Circuits are exported as two rows in the file, one with anObject type of "Item Custom Field" and another with an Object type of "Circuit Custom Field".To add, edit, or delete Custom Fields and their list contents in bulk via CSV Import/Export:1. On the Pick List Choices tab, select the Export icon > Export into an Import Template OR Download ImportTemplate option.2. If exporting into an import template, select one or all lists.3. Save the file in your desired location with the desired file name.4. In the resulting CSV file, make your changes following the instructions provided in the CSV file.5. Save your changes.6. Back in the dcTrack UI, click the Import icon to import the updated file into dcTrack.Note: To delete a Custom Field that is applicable to both Items and Circuits you must include two Delete rows in thefile, one for each Object type. If only one Delete row is included, the Custom Field will only be considered no longerapplicable to that Object type.System Administrators can specify single-select and multi-select pick lists among the types for Custom Fields. Onceone of these list types is selected, you can create the custom options for each list. You can also make changes to thelist contents for Standard Fields.Existing pick lists are displayed in the left panel. Pick list choices are displayed in the right panel. The right panel isalso where you will create, edit, and delete picklist choices.Note: To add, edit, or delete a Custom Field pick list, you must add, edit, or delete the Custom Field with the single-or multi-select pick list in the Custom Fields tab.

1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Pick List Choices tab.2. In the Pick List Choices tab, click the Create button.3. The Create bar will display immediately above the Pick List grid.4. In the Create bar, provide the following information:a. Pick List Choice Label: The name of the pick list choiceb. Class: The classes the pick list is valid for. You can select multiple classes.5. Click the Add icon to add the pick list option. Click the Cancel icon to abort creation and collapse the Createbar.6. Optional. To reorder the pick list options, select the option you want to reorder and click the Move Up or MoveDown icons until the pick list option is in your desired position. By default, new pick list options are positionedat the bottom of the list.Inline editing is supported for the Pick List grid, so authorized users can simply select the cell they want to edit tomake changes.1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Pick List Choices tab.2. In the Pick List Choices tab, select the Pick List and the cell that you want to edit. The grid will allow you tomake changes directly to the cell content by typing in the cell or selecting new values from the available lists.Your changes will save automatically once you have completed your edits and exited the cell.

1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Pick List Choices tab.2. In the Pick List Choices tab, select the Pick List and Pick List Choice that you want to delete.3. Click the Delete icon.Note: If the Pick List Choice is not in use, the item will simple be deleted. However, if it is in use, dcTrack will displaya dialog asking you to confirm the deletion before proceeding.Users with the System Administrator role can add, edit, delete Standard and Custom Fields and their list contentsvia bulk import. All other users require both the Manage Lists and Bulk Import auxiliary roles to add, edit, deleteStandard and Custom Fields list contents via bulk import.To add, edit, or delete Standard and Custom Fields and their list contents in bulk via CSV Import/Export:1. On the Pick List Choices tab, select the Export icon > Export into an Import Template OR Download ImportTemplate option.2. If exporting into an import template, select one or all lists.3. Save the file in your desired location with the desired file name.4. In the resulting CSV file, make your changes following the instructions provided in the CSV file.5. Save your changes.6. Back in the dcTrack UI, click the Import icon to import the updated file into dcTrack.

System Administrators can customize Custom Field sub-tab layouts for use on Item Detail, Circuit Detail, PartsModel Detail and Part Instance pages, including adding, editing, and deleting panels and the Custom Fieldsassigned to each panel. This feature helps System Administrators organize data in ways that make sense for theirusers.Note: The Item Custom Field Subtab feature has been enhanced increasing the limit of subtabs from 4 to 14. Userscan limit the number of subtabs displayed for individual Items by grouping the custom fields displayed on a givensubtab by Class.Standard and Custom Field sub-tabs are listed in the left panel of the Design Sub-tabs panel under the Settings tab> Field Management. The left panel is also where you can add and delete Item Custom Field sub-tabs. The rightpanel is where you can add, edit, and delete panels and the Custom Fields assigned to each panel. Up to four ItemCustom Field sub-tabs can be configured, each with unlimited panels and Custom Fields. While you can not addadditional Sub-tabs for Circuit Details, you can add an unlimited number of panels to this Sub-tab.To configure Custom Field panels for the Item Details pages:Create a new Custom Field sub-tab or use an existing Custom Field sub-tabAdd panels to the sub-tabAdd Custom Fields to each panel - Custom fields added to Item Detail panels must be applicable to at leastone Item ClassTo configure Custom Field panels for the Circuit Detail page:Select the Circuit Detail Sub-tab from the left side panelAdd panels to the sub-tabAdd Custom Fields to each panel - Custom fields added to Circuit Detail panels must be applicable to eitherPower or Data CircuitsTo configure Custom Field panels for the Parts Model and Parts Detail pages:Parts Models and Parts Instances support a single Custom Field sub-tab eachSelect the Part Custom Field or Part Model Custom Field sub-tab from the left side panelAdd panels to the sub-tabAdd Custom Fields to each panel - Custom fields added to the Part Detail panels must be applicable to atleast one Part ClassPart Custom Fields with the "Apply To Models" option checked can be added to either the Part Custom Fieldsub-tab or the Part Custom Field sub-tab.Panels are ordered from top left to bottom right by default. For example, the panel with an ID of 1 would be at the topleft, the panel with an ID of 2 would be at the top right, the panel with an ID of 3 would be at the bottom left, and soon. Panels can be reordered and resized from their default positions by dragging and dropping.Note: Standard Field sub-tabs cannot be edited or deleted and will display a "cannot be modified" message in theright panel if selected.

1. In the Web Client, click the Settings tab > Fields Management > Design Sub-tabs tab.2. To create a new Item Detail sub-tab, in the Custom Fields tab, in the left panel, click the Add a Sub-tab tab.The new sub-tab will immediately be added with a Sub-tab Title of Custom Field [n], where n represents anumber from 1 to 4, depending on the quantity of existing Custom Field sub-tabs at the time of creation. Thenew sub-tab will automatically be selected, and the right panel populated with Custom Fields that have notyet been placed on other panels.3. To configure an existing sub-tab, select the sub-tab in the left panel.4. Click the Class dropdown for the sub-tab in the left panel to specify its classes.5. Configure your sub-tab with panels.a. In the right panel of the Design Sub-tabs tab, click the Add a Panel button. The new panel will auto-matically be added to the selected sub-tab with a default name of New Panel. Click the Add a Panelbutton multiple times for multiple panels.b. In the panel, click the Rename icon to rename the panel.c. Type the desired panel name in the field. Click the Save icon to save your changes. Click the Cancelicon to abort.d. Drag and drop to resize and reorder your panels.e. To delete a panel, click the Delete icon within the panel.6. Configure your panels with Custom Fields.a. From the list of Unplaced Custom Fields in the right panel, select a Custom Field and drag it to thedesired panel. Note: Custom Fields that are applicable to both Item and Circuit Classes may be placedon both an Item Detail sub-tab and the Circuit Detail sub-tab, however they may only be placed onceon each.b. To delete a Custom Field from the panel, click the Cancel (X) icon to the right of the Custom field. Thiswill make the deleted Custom Field available for placement on other panels.7. To view your Item Detail Custom Field sub-tab on an Item Details page, go to the Assets tab > Items List.a. Select an item of the class selected for your Custom Field sub-tab.b. Click the Custom Field sub-tab on the Item Details page.8. To view your Circuit Detail Custom Field sub-tab, go to the Connectivity > Circuit Lista. Select a Circuit from the list and click the Circuit Detail button from the tool barb. You can also view the Circuit Detail Custom Fields while viewing a Circuit Trace by clicking the CircuitDetail button on the Circuit Trace tool bardcTrack allows you to define additional fields that are required in order for a user to save an item in the Web Client.This applies for both standard and custom fields.The Required property can be applied to an entire Class or to only specific Subclasses within a class.Changes to required fields affect only items that are added to dcTrack after the required field change is applied.Items that are already saved to the database are not affected.For example, if you make the Alias field required for new device items, existing device items are not affected by thenewly required field. However, if you edit an existing item and a field's required status changes, the new requiredfields are applied.The following fields are required by default by dcTrack for all item types and cannot be changed:MakeModelItem nameLocationTo make a standard or custom field required/not required:1. In the Web Client, select the Settings tab > Fields Management.2. Click the Field Properties tab.3. In the Field Properties tab, select Required from the dropdown.4. From the list of Standard and Custom fields, check the checkbox for each item class that you want the field to berequired for. Uncheck the checkbox to make the field optional. When you set the field(standard or custom) toRequired for a class it applies to all its sub classes. If a custom field applies to only subclass, you can set thefield property Required for that subclass. However when the Custom Field applies to all the subclasses of aclass, you can set the Field Property Required only for the class and not for the individual subclass.5. Click the Save icon to save your changes.

dcTrack allows you to define additional fields that are hidden in order to present a cleaner, more relevant ItemDetails page to users in the Web Client. The Hidden property applies only to Standard Fields.The Hidden property can be applied to an entire Class or to only specific Subclasses within a class.To make a standard field hidden/visible:1. In the Web Client, select the Settings tab > Fields Management.2. Click the Field Properties tab.3. In the Field Properties tab, select Hidden from the dropdown.4. From the list of Standard fields, check the checkbox for each field that you want hidden. Uncheck the checkboxto make the field visible.5. Click the Save icon to save your changes.dcTrack allows you to define additional fields whose values must be unique in order for a user to save an item in theWeb Client. This applies for both standard and custom fields.To make a standard or custom field unique/not unique:1. In the Web Client, select the Settings tab > Fields Management.2. Click the Field Properties tab.3. In the Field Properties tab, select Must Be Unique from the dropdown.4. From the list of Standard and Custom fields, check the checkbox for each field that you want the field value to beunique for. Uncheck the checkbox to define the field value as not unique.5. Click the Save icon to save your changes.Note: Some Standard Fields are unable to be specified as Must Be Unique. In these cases, the checkbox in theMust Be Unique column will be inaccessible.

dcTrack allows you to define additional fields with default values to make it faster and easier to capture asset data.This applies for both Standard and Custom Fields.To define a default value for a Standard or Custom Field:1. In the Web Client, select the Settings tab > Fields Management.2. Click the Field Properties tab.3. In the Field Properties tab, select Default Value from the dropdown.4. From the list of Standard and Custom fields, double-click in each cell in the Default Value column that you wantto have a default value. Otherwise, leave the cell blank.5. Click the Save icon to save your changes.Note: Some Standard Fields do not support Default Values. In these cases, the cells in the Default Value columnwill not be accessible.Note: Default values for Standard Fields will only be set when creating Items via the UI. Default values will not beset for Standard Fields when creating via File Import or API. Default values for Custom Fields can be set from theUI as well as File Import and API as long as the field is not included on the Import Sheet for Import or the Requestpayload for APIs.dcTrack allows you to define Tooltips. A Tooltip is text that provides additional information you want to supply for afield. This property applies for both Standard and Custom Fields. Once defined, Tooltips are displayed whenever auser hovers over the field.Steps to create Tooltips for a field:1. Navigate to Settings > dcTrack Settings > Fields Management.2. Click the Field Properties tab.3. In the Field Properties tab, select Tooltip from the dropdown.4. From the list of Standard and Custom fields, double-click in the Tooltip column for whose custom field youwant to set.5. Click the Save button to save your changes.

The following table includes standard fields and their descriptions for dcTrack.Application Crit-icalityApplicationNamesApplication Loca-tionsFor making logical groups of cabinets. Used in the IT Items\Cabinets, Visualize\Elevations and IPCabinet GroupingsSubnets pages.Cable Grade For identifying grading of cables. Used in the Media field for Data Panel ports.For color coding of ports and IP Subnets. Used in all Item pages for color coding ports. Also used inColorsIP Subnets page for color coding subnets.CustomersData Rates The values available in the Data Rates drop-down when configuring Data Ports.Used in the IT Items\Device page to identify the Domain of a server or when assigning IPDomainsaddresses.Hostname SuffixSuffix added to the Name of a server to create the DNS name for that server. Used in the IP Sub-Listnets page.Item Function Used to identify the function of an Item. Used in all Item pages.Item Substatus Single-select pick-list field used to provide additional information on an item's status.Item Type Used to identify the Type of an Item. Used in all Item pages.Used to identify the OS of a server in the IT Items\Device page in the Configuration sub-tab of allOperating SystemsItem Details pages.User defined port name . Applies to Item Power Supply ports, Rack PDU Ports (inlets and outlets),Data Ports, Data Panel Ports. Also applies to Model Data ports, Power Supply ports, Rack PDUPort AliasPower Ports. When set at the Model level, items created for the model will inherit the Alias butcan be changed at the Item level.User defined port Status. Manage from Field Management Pick List options. Applies to Item PowerPort StatusSupply ports, Rack PDU Ports (inlets and outlets), Data Ports, Data Panel Ports.Used to identify a Data Port’s Protocol and Data Rate. Used in the Data Ports section of all ItemPort Protocolspages.Used to identify the Fuse or Circuit Breaker within a Rack PDU, in the Power Item\Rack PDU page,Rack PDU Fusesand in the Models Library to select and make assignments.For identifying the Service Level Profile of a particular item in the Item Details Asset and Main-SLA Profiletenance sub-tab.Used to identify logical names of subnets and to build the full name of a subnet. Used in the IP Sub-Subnets/VLANsnets page, for tagging all Data Ports, and when making IP address assignments.Virtual MachineFor identifying the Cluster that a VM or a VM host belongs to. Used in the Item Details Con-Clustersfiguration sub-tab of all IT Items\Device pages.Wire GaugeUsed to tag Power Outlet ports with the electrical cable gauge.(AWG)Part Status Pick List Choices for Part StatusParts Action Pick List Choices for Parts ActionLocation Type Pick List Choices for Location TypeProject Status Pick List Choices for Project StatusProject Substatus Pick List Choices for Project SubstatusRelationships Pick List Choices for RelationshipsTicket Other Pur-Pick List Choices for Ticket Other PurposeposeTicket Priority Pick List Choices for Ticket PriorityTicket Severity Pick List Choices for Ticket SeverityTicket Status Pick List Choices for Ticket StatusTicket Assigned To Pick List Choices for Ticket Assigned ToFields prefixedPicklist choices for custom fieldswith CFCustom FieldUsed for creating custom fields for use with all items or applied to specific item classes.HeadingsThe following table includes Custom Field attributes and their descriptions for dcTrack.Number of times inThe number of times the field is in use.useLabel Select from a list of available classes, including an option to apply to all classes.Select any combination of available item classes and subclasses, circuits, projects, parts and tick-Class(Subclass)ets.Type Select from one of the available types for custom fields. See Custom Field Types.Subtab Subtab where the custom field is placed.Panel Panel where the field is displayed in the Custom Fields sub-tab of the Items Detail page.The order in which the field is displayed in the Panel. By default, new custom fields are placedOrderlast.Must be unique Select if the field should be marked as unique.Required Indicates if the field is required.Default value Default value for the field.Tooltip Text that will appear when hovering over a Standard or Custom field

In dcTrack 6.0.0 and above, System Administrators can specify data types for Custom Fields for better data integrityand quality control.dcTrack version 8.0.0 also introduced support for "Tags" data types. The “Tags” data type is similar to the existingMultiSelect data type in that users can define pick list options for Tags. Tags also allow the user to select multipleoptions from the list when supplying data in a Tag field. The difference is, Tags also allow the user to add options onthe fly while inputting data in the field. Options that are added during input become part of the list and will be avail-able for future selection. This is true when managing data for these fields either from the Web UI, File Import orREST APIs.When adding a custom field on the Custom Fields sub tab of the Settings > Fields Management page, you can selectthe Type from the dropdown list:The following types are available for custom fields:TextText Area (for larger display area of text)NumericDate (mm/dd/yyyy format)Checkbox for booleanSingle-select pick listMulti-select pick listTagsContactsNote: Upon upgrade to dcTrack 6.0.0, Custom Fields of the type “Text” will be migrated and included in the CustomFields sub-tab in Item Details pages.Note: Starting with dcTrack 6.0.0, a custom field can be associated with multiple classes. On upgrade, multipleinstances of a custom field that were associated with different classes will be consolidated into a single custom fieldassociated with multiple classes. For example, the custom field “Services” for Device class and the custom field“Services” for Network class will be consolidated in a single instance of “Services” that will be associated with theDevice and Network classes.
